176566.name: Road to Madness: NCAA Basketball
176566.description:
Road to Madness is a print & play, solitaire statistical replay game on College Basketball, featuring individual yearbooks with data for all Division I teams and also for the entire NCAA Tournament brackets.

Each team is rated for offense and defense and the game is resolved comparing the opposing team values and rolling a couple of 6-sided dice on a Result table, with modifiers given by a random die modifier, that could be activated or not activated at all, according to real performance during the season or the tournament (a team with a winning record has more chance to activate the random modifier than a team with a losing record, but there is the possibility to the underdog to win a match).

As most of TCS Games sport design, the game privileges easiness and speed of play than deepness and strategy (is a solo game after all, and the player takes both sides, so he doesn't have to make any decision).

Two yearbooks available till now: 1977/78 and 1978/79

176567.name: Mingle & Murder
176567.description:
In Mingle & Murder, you are attending a dinner party where one guest after another is found dead. It is now a fight against the clock. Will the murderer get away or will the Inspector catch him or her? Will the guests be saved by the doctor or will they take the opportunity to enrich themselves? Whatever happens, this party will indeed be the talk of the high society!

Each player has a unique objective.


The Murderer wants to murder two guests by playing them murder cards.
The Inspector wants to arrest the murderer by being played a murder card and prevent items from being stolen by playing the guests catch cards.
The Doctor wants to save the guests by playing them save cards or be played a murder card.
Each Guest has a unique list of three rooms that they want to steal valuable items from.
A murdered Guest may still win by identifying the murderer at the end of the game.


Each player starts with a secret hand of one object card and five action cards. Most action cards are mingle cards of no importance. However, the Murderer has three murder cards, the Inspector has three catch cards and the Doctor has three save cards. The game board consists of 3x3 room cards, on which the players move their meeples.

The players take turns to move between the rooms and leave action markers there (steal from it). They may also leave action markers with another player (steal from him or her). When a player has no action marker left, he or she leaves the game board. When all but one have left, the round ends. Players place and draw new cards where they have placed their action markers, shuffle and resolve them. The game ends when an object is fulfilled. A murdered player is eliminated but may still win by identifying the murderer.

Mingle & Murder has a player elimination mechanism with a unique twist: the eliminated player may avenge his or her death by identifying the winner (the murderer) and claim the victory!

176568.name: Daring Racers
176568.description:
Daring Racers is a print & play, semi-statistical solitaire game on motor racing, with single yearbook dedicated to several different Formula 1 or NASCAR season.
Each Yearbook has data for all the drivers (or drivers that started at least two races or complete one in NASCAR),
Each driver is rated for qualifying ability and racing ability; there are also data for his/her propensity to retire (for mechanical reasons or for an accident).
Each race is resolved through a series of dice rolls where each driver gains or loses positions against a "0" point. Through this system the starting grid is frayed very soon and the race develops in a constant fight, made of passes and change of positions.
Till now the following Yearbooks has been released:
NASCAR 1949 to 1959
Formula 1 1950 to 1999

176569.name: World Cup Alpine Ski
176569.description:
World Cup Alpine Ski is a print & play, solitaire, statistical replay game on Alpine Ski, featuring individual yearbook for several seasons of the World Cup.
The game permits to replay each event (downhill, Super G, Giant Slalom or Slalom) from that year, and has data for all skiers (both men and women) that got points during that year.
There are two methods of resolution: a very fast one, where for each race you roll three dice for each skier, add his/her racing value, and got a final classification for the race; and a medium complexity one, where you roll for each skier against the average time given for the race (based on historical results) and you get the final classification through the fastest to the slowest ones.
Until now the following Yearbooks have been released: from 1967 to 1988

176570.description:
From the publisher:
Fearless Gauls take part in a great expedition. They will travel through forests, seas and visit many Roman camps and even Egipt! To proof their accomplishment they must come back with Roman helmets.

In this game players race around the board formed of cards. In a turn a player has to swap a card which lays between him and the first opponent behind him. After swapping she moves to the first card in front of her which shows the same picture as the card just swapped. If a player passes the village she receives a Roman helmet.

The first player to stop on village with 5 Roman helmets or the first to gather 8 helmets is the winner.

This game is a Polish version of Ahoy. It's almost the same game, but one rule is added. Originally the goal of the game was to stop on the starting card with 5 tokens, while here it is also possible to win by gathering 8 of them.
176570.name: Asteriks: Wielka wyprawa

176574.name: wish you were here...?
176574.description:
This is a geographical card game based on a popular TV travel show. The aim of the game is to accumulate 10 golden travel cards over a series of rounds.

In each round, players compete to place numbers on each of the 7 regions: Asia, Europe, Far East, Africa, North American and South America. (only five are used in the two player game)

During a turn, a player with play a card, then draw a card (either from the discard pile, or the deck). Play continues until the deck runs out.

Note: There is an optional for playing with the trivia cards included in the game.

176575.description:
デザインタウン: 再利用 (Design Town: Reuse), an expansion for the deck-building game Design Town, includes two different double-sided cards, with 10 copies of each card. The cards are:


Hardware store/urban redevelopment office: This interferes with the development of your opponent's cities.
Flea market/recycling box: This card can be used when needed to give you extra money.
176575.name: デザインタウン: 再利用 (Design Town: Reuse)

videogamebg: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game
176576.name: Boss Monster
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game App Nominee
176576.description:
Become a boss, build a dungeon, and destroy puny heroes! The best-selling indie card game is becoming a video game.

Digital Boss Monster will mimic all the gameplay available in the tabletop version while also taking advantage of the digital format to enhance your play experience. You will be able to play Digital Boss Monster on PC, Kindle, iPad & Android tablets.

Source: The Game Website.

176578.name: Back to Bed
176578.description:
In Back to Bed you have to guide the sleepwalker Bob from his sleep inducing office to the safety of his bed by controlling his subconscious guardian Subob, whose job it is to both guide and protect the sleepwalking Bob.

The pair will travel through a surreal and painting like world where the boundaries between Bob’s dream and reality have vanished, but where there are still real world dangers that threaten the sleepwalker. Ever vigilant Subob must now guide Bob around dangers and back to bed.

Unique surreal and artistic game universe: A dream universe that mixes elements from the real world and the dream world to create something unique.
Full 3D isometric puzzle levels: Navigate detailed 3D levels and use elements of the level to create a safe path and avoid dangers.
Two characters as one: Play as the embodied subconscious trying to save its own sleeping body by getting it to the safety of the bed.
Picturesque visual style: Discover the feeling of playing in a painting inspired by surreal art and impossible shapes.




Source: The Developer Website.

176579.name: Da Vinci Machine
176579.description:
Detect. Deduce. Decode. A Battle of Wits over the Code Machine. A word game for the critical mind.

Da Vinci is a genius in coding messages creatively. In this game, you will stretch your imaginative and logical mind to crack the secret behind the Code Machine. Come unlock the genius within! The product is a beautiful fusion of a word game and a logic game. Its interactive game-play makes it a great piece for friends and family pastimes. The difficulty levels are controlled by players, so it is also a nice adult-child educational toy. Something special about this product is that it features a patented word coding method that is unique, but easy to understand. So while enjoying the fun and challenge, players can gain knowledge of vocabulary and coding.

Easy to learn. How to play ...
Step 1: Draw two game cards to determine the "Word Type" and "Spelling Condition" of the secret word to be formed. Reveal the two cards to all players.
Step 2: One player uses the chips to form a secret word by the method illustrated on the Code Machine. Cover it with all windows closed.
Step 3: The other player(s) must crack the secret word with as few windows opened as possible. Ask questions wisely for hints in the process. The player that requires less windows opened is the winner.


In a two-player game, one player is the Encoder, the other the Decoder. The Encoder forms a secret word by the method illustrated on the Code Machine using the information from the "Word Type" and "Spelling Condition" cards, starting from the farthest left position, in correct spelling sequence, and announcing the number of letters in the word. In each round, the Decoder opens one small window at any position and attempts to name the secret word. In each game, the Decoder has a total of three changes to ask the Encoder a yes-or-no question for a hint. The questions can be used all at once or separately. When the secret word is cracked, count the number of windows opened. Switch roles and repeat. The player who required less open windows to decode the secret word is the winner.

In a three-player game, one player is the Encoder and the other two players are the competing Decoders. The Decoders take turns opening windows and attempting to crack the secret word. The Decoder who successfully cracks the secret word first is the winner.

176581.name: Network Negotiator
176581.description:
Network Negotiator is a game about the television industry. Players represent high-powered executives who buy and sell TV programs. The game was developed as a promotional item for Turner Broadcasting.

The object of the game is the accumulation of television ratings points. After each player is given one million dollars and assigned a company (CNN, TBS, Headline News, etc.) an assortment of programs will be available for purchase.

The session proceeds for a previously agreed upon number of rounds as players negotiate and gather ratings points. An executive can choose a risky move with ratings based on the roll of the dice or accept "guaranteed" ratings with a safe choice. A special set of Monkey Wrench cards can be used to wreck another player's deal.

At the end of the game a Blockbuster Round is played with three unique programs (Election Night Coverage. etc.) are auctioned and ratings points are totaled. The player with the highest ratings is declared the winner.

The game includes a colorful board, play money, a score pad, 40 Program cards, 16 Monkey Wrench cards, 3 Blockbuster cards, dice, rules, and a storage insert.

176582.description: Star Trek - Attack Wing: U.S.S. Delta Flyer Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 19 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
176582.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Delta Flyer Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

176583.description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.K.S. Rotarran Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 19 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Rotarran is a B'rel class ship.
176583.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Rotarran Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

176584.description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: R.I.S. Talvath Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 18 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Talvath is a Romulan Science Vessel.
176584.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – R.I.S. Talvath Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

176585.name: The Technomancer
176585.description:
On the run from the Secret Police and confronted by the harsh realities of the Red Planet, you must undertake a quest that takes you through tribal communities, cities lost under the ice, and dystopian shanties sprawled across Mars’ dusty embrace.

Faced with the cruelty of Mars’ iron-fist enforcers and wild-life, can you survive long enough to uncover the truth behind The Technomancer?


A unique and thrilling science-fiction RPG experience set on the Red Planet.
Bond with numerous unique and interesting companions and reveal secrets about their past.
Manage their inventory and level up your companions.
Up to five different endings for many quests changing the conclusions and rewards – even the people you’ll meet and journey with!
A dynamic crafting system that changes the visual appearance of weapon and armor.
Play as a Technomancer – a combat proficient warrior with use of cybernetically enhanced magical abilities.


Source: The Publisher Website.

176586.name: Hagiga
176586.description:
Hagiga - a perfect way to learn more about Jewish holidays while playing with your kids in fun and entertaining way!

There are 72 perfect quality colorful cards with various concepts of Jewish Holidays.
The rule of the game is very simple - find 3 cards among 15 spread on the table which all together point to exactly one Jewish Holiday and shout the holiday name.

The winner is the one who collected maximum number of cards.

This is actually very educational game because while playing it you'll find yourself thinking and discussing with your kids various questions about Jewish holidays. For example:

To which holidays King David is related?
When Ecclesiastes is read?
Is Fast related also to Passover and Rosh Hashanah?
To which holidays is Sefirat HaOmer related?
Are Shiv'at HaMinim related only to Tu Bishvat?




and more...

176587.name: Skits-o-Frantic
176587.description:
Skits-o-Frantic is a party game for people that like to make a fool of themselves.

In this game you will be divided up into teams and act out scenarios that can be politically incorrect, but that’s what makes it fun!

The game is simple. Each round, one person from a team draws three card and acts out the scenario without saying any of those words. The person's teammates then attempt to guess what’s on the three cards.

176588.description:
Format: In development; board wargame and VASSAL module.

A Glorious Chance is a solitaire wargame that puts you in command of the U.S. or British naval squadron on Lake Ontario in the critical summer of 1813.
You have four months to dominate the lake. But each patrol, each convoy mission, each amphibious landing you make to pursue victory risks full-scale battle with the AI squadron – a battle that could leave you triumphant or shattered in a matter of hours. A dynamic card-driven AI opponent assigns enemy missions, refits and launches new ships, and plots raids on your supply routes and coastlines.

Your objective: Control Lake Ontario by the end of the summer campaign, without losing your own squadron. The AI squadron's strategic objectives and battle tactics react dynamically to your moves.

Gameplay: Make decisions about ship missions and assignment zones. Scout and shadow enemy forces to identify them. Intercept detected enemy forces. Make amphibious assaults. Attack and defend supply convoys.

What's special about this game:

1. The only operational age-of-sail game that’s below monster size, playable in approximately four hours, and requires no specialized knowledge of ship-handling or period tactics.

2. This campaign has never before been the specific focus of a wargame. (To the extent that it appears at all in wargames, it’s either been part of a full-war strategic game, or a small scenario within tactical naval games that cover the general Napoleonic period.)
176588.name: A Glorious Chance: The Naval Struggle for Lake Ontario, 1813

176589.description:
Cat Box is played with cards divided into quadrants each showing an empty box or one of five cats (in a box). Players take turns playing these cards to a shared display, overlapping previous cards by one or two quadrants. Each player is assigned a secret identity; if you are a cat you want as many of your cats showing at the end of the game as possible, and as large a group of them as possible, but if you are the chihuahua you want empty boxes and groups of exactly three cats.

Players can play cards held by themselves or any of their opponents, but one side of the card is used when playing your own cards and the other (mirror image) side when playing other peoples'.

The advanced game adds five single-use tokens for each player which have different effects.
176589.name: Cat Box

176590.name: Savage Characters, Volume One
176590.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grab a Character and Get Savage!
The Savage Characters series utilizes the Savage Worlds Deluxe game engine to present TWENTY ORIGINAL CHARACTERS. Each character is defined with a rich background, full body portrait, full stats as a Legendary figure, the complete build path to play them at whatever experience level you choose, and five adventure ideas (one for each rank). Used together, these friends and foes, PCs and NPCs present entwined histories and related adventures.

The characters are grouped into four Dragonlaird Gaming settings with five characters in each setting. The settings are original but the characters could be easily used in other games of the haunted west, fantasy, modern horror, or space opera genres.

Dark Ages & Dragon Gods: A beautiful traveling noblewoman hides a secret life as the larcenous Lady of Red Silk. Out of love, a grizzled mercenary from Moorish Iberia keeps the noblewoman safe A priest of the Dragon God with a secret carries out the will of the Roman Draconic Church.

Demon Streets & Made Men: A nightmare from another dimension controls one of the Five Families and plots to consume New York City into a soulless Hell. A hideous creature skulks in shadows, influencing minds and enacting the schemes of its master. A Catholic made man for the Romanos learns of the growing darkness and vows to protect his city from Satan.

Ghost Lands & Sixguns: A mad scientist performs twisted experiments in a hidden lair in the Sierra Mountains. An American Black Bear is made intelligent by science and takes up a gun and crime. A heartless thug parlays violence and schemes into rule of the town of Miasma Springs.

Theta Ships & Iron Men: A disgraced captain of the Royal Stellar Navy hunts the creature who stole his flagship from him. An alien bounty hunter burdened with a rigid moral code travels the Galaxy after criminals. A spy for the ancient Spironetti Empire seeks to rock the foundations of her own people.

Whether you are a Gamemaster using these characters and adventures to enrich your campaign world or a player looking for a different sort of character, Savage Characters is sure to Fire Up Your Game!

176591.name: 怪盗ルパン・キャット (Lupin Cat)
176591.description: In 怪盗ルパン・キャット (Lupin Cat), players represent a dog detective team that's trying to track down everyone's favorite food, but hiding amongst them is Lupin Cat, whose only goal is to escape with their favorite food...

176592.name: Thinktanku
176592.description:
Thinktanku is the hilarious party game where players design, create, and brainstorm titles and descriptions for apps, movies, products, restaurants, and websites! The CEO reads the card aloud and asks the other players to create a description or title based on the drawn card.

Players have 1 minute to write their answers. The CEO chooses their favorite response after 1 minute. The winning player is awarded a point. The first player to reach the set number of winning points wins the game!

176593.name: 大盗賊・猫右衛門 (NEGOEMON)
176593.description: In 大盗賊・猫右衛門 (NEGOEMON), players represent cats who are taking on various roles and you're trying to guess what those roles are in order to collect treasure.

176594.description:
Add new strategic options and speed up the start of gameplay with this mini-expansion for Zeppelin Attack! With Meddling Fools you'll have a different opportunity each turn to bend the rules of the game, reveal a hidden ally, and strike at your enemies.

The Meddling Fools deck sits alongside the others, with its top card turned up and offering a different option each turn. Gain extra battle points with the Mad Bomber, shift your resources to deal with Heroic Meddling, or launch additional attacks with Methuselah's Infiniplane.

The skies shall be yours!

Includes 8 cards for use in play, plus two rules cards for tableside reference — which, conveniently, hits the "minimum of 10 cards to place an order" requirement. :)
176594.name: Zeppelin Attack!: Meddling Fools

boardgameimplementation: The Great Battles of Alexander: Deluxe Edition
176596.description:
The Great Battles of Alexander - Macedonian Art of War Expanded Deluxe Edition (2014, Fourth Printing) is the first volume of the multi-volume counters-on-hexagons famous wargame Great Battles of History series, with the latest and updated 5th Edition game rules made by Mark Herman & Richard Berg.

Available Battles (19 in total):

Scenario Book (12):
Erigon Valley (358 BC)
Crocus Fields (352 BC)
Chaeronea (338 BC)
Lyginus (335 BC)
Pelium (355 BC)
Granicus (334 BC)
Issus (333 BC)
Gaugamela (331 BC)
Crossing the Jaxartes (329 BC)
Samarkand (329/328 BC)
Arigaeum (327 BC)
Hydaspes (326 BC)

Phalanx Module (2):
Sellasia (221 BC)
Mantinea (207 BC)

Diadochoi Module (4):
Paraetacene (317 BC)
Gabiene (316 BC)
Gaza (312 BC)
Ipsus (301 BC)

Raphia Module (1):
Raphia (217 BC)





Game Scale Details:
Unit: 100 men per unit strength point
Time: 20 minutes per game turn
Map: 70 yards per hexagon
176596.name: The Great Battles of Alexander: Macedonian Art of War

176597.name: Dreamstarter
176597.description:
User summary:

Dreamstarter is a simultaneous action selection investment card game.

Players have a hand of money cards numbered between 0 and 12. Each round, a venture card is drawn with a specific difficulty. Each player invests a hidden amount, which is then turned up, and dice rolled to see if the venture succeeds, with a higher probability if enough people invested. If the venture succeeds, each investor gains a certain amoung of VP. It takes one round for the used investment cards to return to the hand of the players, and even longer if the venture failed. Event cards throws in other unexpected factors in the game.

Most VP at the end wins.

176599.name: L'Isola del Tesoro
176599.description:
All pirates of the Seven Seas are looking for the Treasure Island, where Barbarosa, the infamous pirate, hid his precious treasure! Are you ready for this incredible voyage? You'll need courage and a bit of luck!

L'Isola del Tesoro is a great adventure game with pirates, ships and treasures. It is a game for the whole family, easy to learn, with a fast gameplay and two bonuses for the bravest pirates.

L'Isola del Tesoro is a basic roll and move game, where you are trying to get from the Start tile to the Treasure Island, progressing through all the Sea tiles placed in a line. On your turn, you roll the six-sided die and move as many spaces as the result of the roll. You flip the tile where you land and apply any effect indicated (move forward one space, move to the tile where stands the last ship, skip your turn...). The first player to reach the Treasure Island wins the game.

The Monster tiles are used to block your progression. When you cross one, you must stop, flip it and stop your turn. On the following turn, you roll the die to try to beat the monster. Whoever beats the monster gets the tile, which doesn't give any advantage.

176600.name: Rondo, mit der großen Drehscheibe
176600.description:
Rondo is a game for 2-4 Players, with a rotary disk on the game board.

The Rotary disk is transparent. Except the start and end fields the whole way with all fields are covered with this disk.
The path on the board is seperated in 2 concentric circles, with the private starts at the outside and the private destinations in the middle.

The base rule is a simple, role the die and move one of your four pawns in direction of your private destination.
The pawns have 2 sizes. If your pawn is larger or equal as the pawn before it, you can pass it with a high die number.
If your pawn is smaller than the pawns on your way you have to stay behind it.

Each pawn can throw out each opponents pawn if the pawn reaches exact the position of it. This is independent of their size.
Some fields are marked. If a pawn hits one of the marked fields, the disk is turned with all pawns on it. The new position is reached, when the players pawn is on the next marked field.
There are only some single links between the circles and only 1 link from the inner circle to your Destination.

Therefor the rotation of all pawns may move them nearer to the destination or they have to run a full round again because they were moved on the wrong side of the link.

boardgamecompilation: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
176601.description:
The Tabletop Edition has a variant box cover and includes the Felicia Day and Kodiak Colby promotional characters.

Game description from the publisher:

"Crossroads" is a new series from Plaid Hat Games that tests a group of survivors' ability to work together and stay alive while facing crises and challenges from both outside and inside.

Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game, the first game in this series, puts 2-5 players in a small, weakened colony of survivors in a world where most of humanity is either dead or diseased, flesh-craving monsters. Each player leads a faction of survivors with dozens of different characters in the game.

Dead of Winter is a meta-cooperative psychological survival game. This means players are working together toward one common victory condition — but for each individual player to achieve victory, he must also complete his personal secret objective. This secret objective could relate to a psychological tick that's fairly harmless to most others in the colony, a dangerous obsession that could put the main objective at risk, a desire for sabotage of the main mission, or (worst of all) vengeance against the colony! Certain games could end with all players winning, some winning and some losing, or all players losing. Work toward the group's goal, but don't get walked all over by a loudmouth who's looking out only for his own interests!

Dead of Winter is an experience that can be accomplished only through the medium of tabletop games. It's a story-centric game about surviving through a harsh winter in an apocalyptic world. The survivors are all dealing with their own psychological imperatives, but must still find a way to work together to fight off outside threats, resolve crises, find food and supplies, and keep the colony's morale up.

Dead of Winter has players making frequent, difficult, heavily- thematic, wildly-varying decisions that often have them deciding between what is best for the colony and what is best for themselves.
176601.name: Dead of Winter: Tabletop Edition

176602.name: Sunken Treasure Game
176602.description: In Sunken Treasure, the player's deep sea diver has to leave the salvage ship to recover a gold bar from a chest at the bottom of the sea. The player must then return the gold bar to the salvage ship.

176603.name: Princes of the Apocalypse Online Supplement
176603.description:
User summary:

Free PDF file detailing magic items, monsters, and spells from Princes of the Apocalypse which are not included in the free Player's Basic Rules and Dungeon Master's Basic Rules downloads.

Version 1 released 8 April 2015 on Wizards of the Coast site (see weblink) in standard and "printer-friendly" forms.

176604.name: Disney's Aladdin ... und die Wunderlampe
176604.description:
This game is based on the Disney movie Aladdin.

Each player has his own Aladdin figure in his color. The players try as fast as possible to get to the palace of the Sultan trying to get the most valuable treasures on their way.

The movement of the figures is card driven. Player plays 1 card from 2 each round and gets after the action is done a new card.

There are the following card types

Aladdin cards: for moving 1 to 5 fields (exact)
Carpet cards: moving to the next carpet field.
Dschafar cards: 1 opponent player has to pause.




If the card played has the same color as the last on the trash pile. The player can play an additional card.

There are Special fields (so called wonder caves). If a figure passes it, he gets a treasure Card without looking on the value.
If he hits the field. The player is allowed to check the value and to decide if he wants this or a blind new one.

Each player has 3 different wishes, he is allowed to use in his turn (1 Opponent 6 fields back, all opponents back 1 to 3 fields, himself 4 fields in front) Maximum 1 wish/turn.

In the palace the player can choose 1 of 4 open treasures (value 1-4) if he is the first. Otherwise one of the remaining

Game Ends when all figures are in the palace. The player with the most valuable treasures gets Jasmin as his wife and wins the game. If 2 have equal treasures the first arrived player wins.

176605.name: Match'n'Turn
176605.description:
Match'n'Turn is a very special lotto!

You must match the images on the tiles with those on your board. It seems simple, but the objects to look for keep changing!

You have to look carefully to gather the most tiles.

176606.description:
Take to the high seas as the captain of your very own pirate ship. Seek out valuable merchant ships and raid them for their goods! Hire new crew, upgrade your ship, and give your treasure to the Pirate King for fame and glory!

Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot takes the fun of rolling dice and combines it with a rich scenario deck to make each game play differently. Each round, the players battle it out with merchant vessels and other ships, trying to grab as much loot as possible. One player takes dice from all the players, rattles them in their hand, then tosses them into the game box to resolve the battle. Where your dice land in the box, in addition to the symbols rolled, determines the results of the battle, then players claim their loot. Players may now return to port to upgrade their ship, hire new crew, or give their goods to the Pirate King for his favor.

When upgrading their ship, players use physical pieces to assemble their vessel, making each ship look different. In the box are dozens of punchboard pieces to customize your ship. In addition to common items and crew members, there will be unique item upgrades and crew that can make your ship stand out among the crowd!

At the end of the game, the player who earned the most favor from the Pirate King wins!
176606.name: Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot
boardgameaccessory: Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot: Metal Coins
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 20: Rattle Battle Grab the Loot and Steam Works
Episode 31: Rattle Battle, Codenames, Trove
Episode 56- Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot and Gaming Relationships
GenCon 2015 - Portal Games
RDTN Episode 65 – A Most Peculiar Man: Portal Games Ignacy Trzewiczek
The Game Pit: Episode 51 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2015 Part 3
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 33

176607.name: 2 Super Spiele: Allegro Zet
176607.description:
This are 2 games in 1 box: Allegro & Zet

For both games: Each player has figures and stones which he moves by dice rolling.
There are possibilities to throw out figures or Stones.
Stones can block the movement of opponent's figures

Allegro:
Start field of the stones is in the middle of the plan. The figures start at a field at the boarder.
On Players turn he moves 1 figur or stone the sum of number of the 2 rolled dice.
Stones can throw out other stones and other figures. They can cross over figures and stones.
Figures can throw out figures and stones but figures are not allowed to pass by stones. Figures are allowed to pass by other figures.
The player whose figures are first on his stones start place and additional the Stones on the figures start place has won.

Zet:
All Stones and figures start at the same place. 2 dice are rolled. The Player chooses 2 Stones or 1 Stone and 1 figure and moves each for the number of 1 of the dice.
Stones are placed on other Stones if they reach exact the same place.
Stones are blocking Stones below them. Figures are also blocking stones below. Figures on stones are save (cannot be thrown out).
Figures throw out other figures if they reach the same place.
Figures and stones are allowed to pass by other figures and stones.
Player whose figures and stones are first on the Destination field wins.

176608.name: Drive to Hell
176608.description:
User Summary

Two people survive a bar being blown up and drive away in a car to get vengeance on the demons responsible. Actually the theme barely makes sense, the real aim of the game is to have a 'car' drive up the screen while you shoot approaching targets. If the targets hit your car enough times, you lose. The graphics are like an arcade game from the 1980s.

176609.name: TORNADO 1-2-3-Im Sausewind, wir sind gespannt, wer heut gewinnt
176609.description:
Each Player has four figures and tries to get first all of the to the centre in the middle of the circle shaped game board.

The movement is dice driven.
If the 2 dice show a double the transparent disk covering the whole gameboard is rotated to the next mark on the board, before the a figure is moved.
All figures are turned around with this disk move.
Due to the fact that the 7 circular paths have gaps some figures may have after the turn a position outside the path.
These have to start at the start field at the boarder again.
Opponet figures can be thrown out by coming exact on their position.
Movement can be done in both directions.

176610.description:
A competitive deck-trashing game for 2-5 players by Florian Woo.

Each player plays a famous Mind Master. These people have telepathic abilities, which allow them to read the minds of others and exchange and extract memories from there.

Every year, the greatest of these Mind Masters meet in a battle for sanity. During these tournaments, they try to bring the most precious memories of each opponent into the foreground, so that they can access and delete these thoughts forever. Only the ones who keep these hidden until the end will stay sane.

Mind Masters is a competitive card game, where each player has an identical 40 cards deck at the beginning. Inside these decks, there a five "Precious Memory" cards, which each player has to protect. They will play cards forcing the others to discard or even trash cards, to finally remove all of their "Precious Memories". Therefore, the deck gets thinner and thinner over game play. The last player keeping at least one of his "Precious Memories" wins.

This game was created for the March 2015 24h design contest at BGG (theme: confusion).
176610.name: Mind Masters

176611.name: 2 Super-Spiele Glückspilz: Master Mix
176611.description:
Box includes 2 Games:
Glückspilz (2-4 players): Looks like Pachisi but with dice instead of pawns.
Master Mix (2 players): Player has to place dice on a chess board.

176613.name: Mosaico
176613.description:
Each player has 45 stones of his Color.
On a player's turn, he rolls a special die. The die sides show the numbers 1-3, card symbol and star.
Rolling a number allows the player to place this number of Stones.
When rolling a card, the player takes a card and tries to fullfill it (e.g. build a special form with his stones)


remove 1 Stone.


In most cases placing stones is only allowed if they are neighboard to each other and to previous placed of the same Color.
Game ends when no field is empty or if one Player has placed all his Stones. The Player who placed the most stones wins the game.
Cover description in 3 languages. The box contains only German rules.

176614.description:
Second expansion set for Dark Tales, this time based on the Little Red Riding Hood fairy tale.

This set includes:

A deck of 26 cards:
24 Playing cards
2 Setting cards (B)

10 items: Baskets
33 victory point tokens with different values
Rulesheet
176614.name: Dark Tales: Little Red Riding Hood

176615.name: King of Tiger Heart
176615.description: In King of Tiger Heart, players represent knights of the kingdom who are trying to regain control of the country — well, all but one of them are as a traitor lurks amongst the knights...

176616.name: Rabbit Project
176616.description:
In 2396, with an invading force surrounding the Earth, different army troops have had genetic implants to grant them the characteristics of a particular animal in order to aid them on missions against this force.

Rabbit Project is a role-playing card game in one player takes the role of the invading Overlord and 1-3 players comprise the rabbit team and work to complete missions with limited supplies available to them.

176617.description:
The Townsfolk Expansion for Shipwrights of the North Sea is a mini expansion which expands the Worker Placement aspects of the game. Included in the expansion is a new central game board, 5 shield tokens and a rule sheet.

On their turn, players may place 1 Worker from their Village, onto the new board. The board features 5 different Townsfolk, each with a unique action for players to take. Such actions include substituting Craftsman when constructing Ships and discarding cards for Gold.

In addition to these new actions, there is 1 minor rule change: Players now start the game gaining 2 Workers each Evening Phase, rather than 1. All other rules of the base game remain.
176617.name: Shipwrights of the North Sea: The Townsfolk Expansion

176618.name: Guess It
176618.description:
A game of deduction and bluffing with eleven playing cards, JT98765432A, and two players.

One secret card is laid face-down in the middle of the table. The rest are dealt between the players. The goal is to guess the secret card. A guess ends the game and determines the winner, according to whether the guess was correct or not.

Players take turns either asking the other if s/he has a given card or making a guess. When asked about a card, the opponent must answer truthfully and lay it face up if the card was held. A player may ask the opponent about a card s/he holds, in which case, s/he will lay it face up on his/her next turn. (The idea is that this bluff might make the opponent make an incorrect guess.)

176619.name: Rebuild 3: Gangs of Deadsville
176619.description:
User Summary

Rebuild 3 is the next installment in the Rebuild series where the player works to manage a small walled-off section of a city as zombies accumulate outside.
The player tells refugees to train, fight, scavenge, or rebuild and reclaim city sections, hoping to push the hoards back while managing food, morale, and health of the colony.

176626.name: Peril on the Purple Planet
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
176626.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Purple Planet: Where tribes of man-beasts wage an endless war beneath a dying sun. Where mighty death orms rule the wastes, befouled winds whistle through ancient crypts, and forests of fungi flourish in the weirdling light. Where ancient technologies offer life ... or a quick death.
Bereft of patron, friend or god, your survival depends on quick wits and a strong blade. Will you and your companions stand as conquerers atop this alien land? Or will you fall beneath the blast of an ink-black death rays, just another corpse left to litter the wastes of the Purple Planet?

176628.name: Skunk in the Campground
176628.description:
Outer Box Description:
In this hilarious game, players draw cards and match pairs. But beware! If the skunk sneaks into your hand, you lose the game. The cards are filled with funny jokes and fun animal facts to share around the campfire.

Setup: Shuffle the Deck. Deal out the cards one at a time to all of the players. Some players may get an extra card. Cards in players hand are always kept hidden from other players. Any cards making pairs are laid down in front of players at this time. Compass cards are not used at this time.

Game Play: The player to the left of the dealer draws one card from the dealers hand. If a pair is made, the pair is laid down immediately. The person now offers cards to the player on his/her left.

Compass Cards: The compass cards are "reverse" cards. If the person who is about to draw holds a compass card, he/she may place it at the center of the table, and then draw a card from the player on his/her opposite side. The order of offering cards reverses until another compass card is played. The game play direction may change up to 3 times as each compass card may only be used once. If a player draws a compass card from another player, it cannot be used until his/her next turn. When there are two players, a player may play a reverse card instead of drawing.

176629.name: Guitar Hero Live
videogamehonor: 2015 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Gamescom Best Family Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Gamescom Best Social/Casual/Online Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Persistent Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Game Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Convergent Game of the Year Nominee
176629.description:
TAKE THE STAGE
Playing music in front of a real crowd is like no other experience. With the new GH Live first-person view, YOU’LL take center stage like never before.

ROCK REAL CROWDS WITH REAL REACTIONS
Feel the rush of performing in a REAL band, in front of REAL crowds who react in REAL time to your performance. You’ll either win the crowd or lose them. Plus, your band mates will also let you know if you’re rocking out or need to pick it up. Fight the stage fright and bring down the house.

AWESOME MUSIC. EPIC VENUES
Guitar Hero Live, you’ll take the stage in a variety of venues. You'll play in the small clubs and on the massive main stage of an outdoor festival, rocking out every step of the way.

Source: The Game Website.

176630.name: Be My Valentine
176630.description: Be My Valentine is a love decipher for more-than-friendly encounters. The players can game themselves into happiness through letter delivery to gauge whether the messages you are receiving from the guy who likes you. Basically, the players can get/lose love points via a series of love actions— sending letters sending letters, confessing love or being a matchmaker. After the end of the game, the player(s) with the most love points is the best lover and wins the game!

176631.description:
In Stratos, players assume the role of rival tribes vying for control of a newly discovered land. Players succeed in their quest by hiring and developing groups of characters that can accumulate resources and exercise unique abilities. Players collect resources from the game board through character actions and spend them to hire new characters and advance their tribe.

Stratos has 5 character classes, each serving a distinct function. The 5 classes and their (promoted forms) are the Peasant (Cultivator), Archer (Marksman), Soldier (Knight), Explorer (Swashbuckler) and Mage (Sorcerer). Each promoted class gains expanded abilities compared to its original version. Enhanced abilities include greater attacks (Knight vs. Soldier), access to stronger spells (Sorcerer vs. Mage), improved resource harvesting (Cultivator vs. Peasant), expanded movement (Swashbuckler vs. Explorer) and increased attack accuracy (Marksman vs. Archer). Characters move from space to space on a tile-based board which can be arranged randomly or according to set maps. Each character can perform up to 2 unique actions per turn with movement being a repeatable action. Available character actions (dependent on class) include Harvest, Travel, Search, Attack, Shoot, Defend, Cast and Use.

Points are awarded by defeating characters, casting unique spells, discovering treasures, hoarding resources, promoting characters and occupying key map locations.

The first player to reach a pre-determined number of Prosperity points (default 10) is declared the winner.

Stratos is a product of Board and Tale Games Inc., a Canadian boardgame publisher based in Hamilton, Ontario.
176631.name: Stratos

176632.name: Zombicide Survivor: Bastian
176632.description: Bastian is a promotional Survivor that was added to Season 3 Kickstarter campaign. A Zombivor version is also included.

176633.name: İhtilal
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 8
TRCP Sunday Fund Day Episode 4
176633.description: İhtilal ("Revolution") is a 2 player strategy board game where the objective is to hold power over the people and the institutions of 1950 to 1980s Turkey. The players choose between centre-left or centre-right. Meanwhile the incidents that shaped the Turkish history appear as "Event Cards" and steer the game, sometimes foiling your plans, sometimes working in your favor. The players try to manage independent political organizations, infiltrate institutions such as the army and the police and make place for themselves on the board as well, which represents various cities and regions. The game takes about 1 hour from start to finish including setup.

176634.description:
Players race to hit opposing players in order to score points, and avoid losing their remaining shields to keep playing.
In turns, players attempt to play a card with equal or greater value than the magic sphere.
Maneuvers and special abilities spice things up a bit.

All the action takes place during finals in the Magic Academy of Arcanya. Where fantasy races attend to learn the misteries of sorcery.
176634.name: Arcanya: Magic Academy

176635.name: Zombies Survive
boardgamepodcastepisode: TRCP Launch Episode 9
176635.description:
Play as a zombie trying to survive encounters with humans in this quick and easy card game.

Each player has a zombie composed of five body part cards which can be gained or lost depending on the outcome of combat with humans. The last player with at least a zombie head remaining is the winner.

Fight back, play "even more dead." or recruit help from other players to ensure your undead survival.

176636.description:
Dungeon Fighter: Rock and Roll is the fourth and last Dungeon Fighter expansion related to the power of the four elements: Fire, Air, Earth and Water. Each expansion can be played by adding cards to the basic game, or mixing them together if you want a completely new and crazy gaming experience.

Rock and Roll contains new monsters and equipment, a new miner hero, not one but two different Final Bosses, and new maps with special rooms. You can accumulate experience points like in a real fantasy game; power cards allow you to activate powerful earth powers, such as the Philosopher's Stone and the Weak Point spells, but beware the new defensive monsters! You will fight using the earth elemental die and, of course, perform new "impossible" die rolls!
176636.name: Dungeon Fighter: Rock and Roll

boardgameintegration: Duel Bots Duel Pack: Crimson Spear
Duel Bots Duel Pack: Crimson Spear
176637.description:
Rocket Fist! Form Galaxy Sword! Omicron Torpedo, fire! Giant robots battle in the style of your favorite Japanese cartoons.

Duel Bots is a card game that lets you design your own deck, load up a giant robot with high-tech components and devastating weapons, then duel head-to-head or in a multi-player death-match.

Duel packs contain two pre-constructed decks. The decks in Galaxy Sword are designed for new players to learn the game. Once you're familiar with the rules the cards can be used alone or with other duel packs to design your own custom deck.

-- Game play summary --

Design your own deck of 32 cards or use a pre-constructed deck from the duel pack. There are three type of cards: components (such as weapons or other gear), resources (which focus on hand management) and damage cards. Damage cards go in a separate pile and you draw them when your robot takes damage. When your damage pile is empty, you lose.

Each turn you may put one component into play from your hand into one of 7 available slots. This sets the pace of the game. Components get more powerful as the game goes on: Tier I components can be played right away but aren't very powerful. You must have 3 components on the table to play a more powerful Tier II component. When 6 of the 7 slots are filled you can play your signature component. Each deck has exactly one signature component, and once they start hitting the table the game will end soon. This follows with the giant robot theme, where mega-weapons tend to decide the battle after some back and forth with smaller attacks.

Damage cards first go into available component slots; you can't play a new component into a damaged slot. You may also put damage on a component on the table, which keeps you from using that component until the damage is removed. Some cards let you move damage to the discard pile where it will eventually cycle back into your hand, so that's just a temporary fix. If instead you pay the cost listed on the damage card you can remove it from the game. There are 5 different kinds of damage with 5 different costs, so choosing compatible damage cards is an important part of deck design. You also choose how many damage cards to use (8 to 12) but the total is always 32 cards, so choosing more "hit points" reduces your available number of components and resource cards.

The game has elements that limit the luck factor present in all card games. Certain resources let you choose cards from your discard pile, others from your draw pile. The small deck size ensures you will see your whole draw pile several times each game. (The discard pile shuffles to form a new draw pile when it's exhausted.) Luck plays a factor in which components come out first and in occasionally finding yourself without a component to play which can put you a turn behind.
176637.name: Duel Bots Duel Pack: Galaxy Sword

176638.name: Olympian Gods
176638.description:
Players try to bring their population to prosperity by gaining the blessings of the olympian gods!
The game uses dice to track population size and a secret bidding mechanism for gaining the god's blessings.
It's a fun mix of some careful planning and scheming but as always, when gods are involved, things can often go horribly wrong and get a bit chaotic!

Overview: In this game players take control of a population (=points, represented by dice) and compete with other players for the favours of gods in hope of being the first player to advance their population to 15 (20 for a longer game, 12 for a shorter game) points and thereby win the game.

Gameplay:
The game is played in several rounds divided into Phases, the „worship phase“ and the „blessing phase“.
During the "worship phase", players play their offering cards on the gods in rounds of secret bidding.
Then in the "blessing phase", the gods are checked in sequence for which players played offering cards on them. The player to have played the highest card receives the "major blessing", all other players to have played any cards with a value greater than 0 receive the "lesser blessing".
blessings can have all kinds of effects, ranging form players directly gaining points by gaining dice or adding points to their dice, but also performing actions like stealing other player's dice or exchanging dice with other players.
When all god's blessings have been resolved play continues with the next round of bidding.

176639.name: Kraken's Cove
176639.description:
Outwit your fellow swashbucklers to claim the treasures hidden in the Cove! the blood seal which lies over the entrance to the Kraken's lair requires items which are identical in nature.

Kraken's Cove is a social Bluffing game inspired by the prisoner's dilemma. it is designed for 4 to 8 players and lasts about 20 minutes.

Treasure cards are placed facedown for the amount of players in the game. each player starts the day with two facedown cards of stolen goods, these can come in many forms from being magical elements, precious gems and sometimes just everyday things such as grass. players must aim to get identical items so that they may access the treasures and score Victory points in the form of Coins.

on their turn players will trade one of the two item cards they have with another player, this is done facedown and both players must agree to the trade. you can be as honest or as dishonest as you like, keep in mind players are after what you may or may not have so keep your wits about you and suss out the liars.

When you have an identical pair you may enter the lair which the kraken sleeps, you may now secretly look at a facedown treasure card. you may now choose to take either take this card or look at another one, the second card however must be taken. the treasure cards have point values on aswell as curses and items which carry bonuses. once all but one of the treasures have been taken all players must flip over their cards and score their winnings.

The player who collects the most coins (victory points) over a period of 7 weeks (rounds) will go home the victor!

Duel Bots Duel Pack: Galaxy Sword

176640.name: Duel Bots Duel Pack: Crimson Spear

boardgameimplementation: The Legend of the Cherry Tree that Blossoms Every Ten Years
176642.description: In ひとひら (Hitohira), players take turns drawing cherry blossoms from a bag, drawing up to three times but possibly being punished in the process. Players can use these blossoms for special abilities, and they can also place them in front of or behind their screen. At the end of the game, a player's score is based on all the blossoms they have.
176642.name: ひとひら (Hitohira)

176643.name: Assassin's Creed Chronicles: China
176643.description:
Chronicles: China features the Chinese assassin Jun in 1526, during the downfall of the Ming Dynasty. As the last remaining Assassin of the Chinese Brotherhood, Jun returns to her homeland with a vendetta. Newly trained by the legendary Ezio Auditore, she is hell-bent on exacting vengeance and restoring her fallen Brotherhood. Reportedly, a sketch of Shao Jun was the inspiration for the game, as well as the other Chronicles games, and the basis for the design of the world.

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's Creed Chronicles", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

176644.name: DarkEnd
176644.description:
DarkEnd is a traditional 2D RPG, where simple yet addictive game-design meets stunning visuals to tell unforgettable tales about love, bravery and sacrifice.
In DarkEnd, you play the role of one of the selected heroes of your choice, and venture into the ever-changing dungeons of DarkEnd, which is filled with numerous treasures, mysterious secrets and the haunting past, in classic dungeon crawler style.
An unforgettable adventure awaits you...

Source: The Game Website.

176645.name: Assassin's Creed Chronicles: India
176645.description:
Chronicles: India will feature Indian assassin Arbaaz Mir in 1841, while the Sikh Empire was at war with the East India Company. When a Master Templar arrives with a mysterious item that used to belong to the Assassin Order, Mir must discover why he’s come, steal back the item, and protect his friends and his lover.

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's Creed Chronicles", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

176646.name: Assassin's Creed Chronicles: Russia
176646.description:
Chronicles: Russia will feature the Russian assassin Nikolai Orelov in 1918, during the aftermath of the October Revolution. Orelov wants to leave with his family, but is required to perform one last mission for the Assassin Order: infiltrate the house where the czar's family is being held by the Bolsheviks and steal an artifact that has been fought over by Assassins and Templars for centuries. Along the way, he witnesses the massacre of the tsar's children, but manages to save the princess, Anastasia. He must escape the Templars while protecting the artifact and Anastasia.

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's Creed Chronicles", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

176647.description:
The objective of El Plan, tú decides is to be the player with most innovate business ideas after twelve rounds (1 year).

In the game there are:

3 resources: money, energy, workforce
3 processes: logistics, production and marketing
3 goods: raw material, consumer goods and services




Every player will receive a business card that tells him which his strengths are. With his abilities he will be able to produce 2 of the 3 kinds of goods the game has. They produce these goods by using processes to transform resources into goods.

The boards has several places where you can get resources, have additional processes, buy and sell goods, buy cards (which give new abilities) and others.

By the end of every year players can transform 3 good, 1 of each, into an innovate idea. This can happen as many times as they like, if they have the necessary goods. Also, innovate ideas can be used as a joker for money, energy or workforce during the game.
Since each player is able to produce only 2 of the 3 goods, they will be forced to buy the third one every time they want to create an innovate idea.
176647.name: El Plan, tú decides

176648.name: Darkshade Chronicles: DC01 A Day in Baru-Kesh
176648.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a delver, limited on experience and eager for adventure. Baru-Kesh is first and foremost a market city and cultural center for the surrounding lands. A festival is celebrated in the early summer when the cattle merchants come to town. The docks are full of cargo ships coming from the distant lands to take advantage of the year's sales. The stockyards and abattoirs brace themselves for the busiest time of the year while the city's population swells with visitors. Merchants arrive to sell their wares and make needed purchases. Revelers come to take part in the glorious festivities. Delvers come to earn some gold and make names for themselves.

A Day in Baru-Kesh is a solo adventure designed for low level Rogues or Warriors with 30 or less total combat adds. To play, you will need some 6 sided dice, pencil and paper to write down some game notes, and a basic knowledge of the Tunnels & Trolls™ game rules.

Includes 200 paragraph solo adventure and a 37 page GM adventure.

176649.name: Darkshade Chronicles: DC00 Quick Start Guide for Tunnels & Trolls Solo Adventures
176649.description: You see all these T&T solo adventures available but you have no experience with the system? Use this guide to answer any questions you have about character creation, saving rolls, combat, and spells.

176650.name: Partisan Politics
176650.description:
A game in which players vote their issues closer to the speaker of the house in order to increase their value before scoring. Players move issues by playing a copy from their hand to their constituency, or increase the constituency by polling and choosing an issue from the top 3 cards of the deck.

The goal of the game is to score the most over the course of 5 phases/hands. Each phase increases the number of things that are voted on by the players instead of being accomplished automatically.

Each hand ends when enough cloture motions have accumulated to force the vote. At the end of the hand, players choose a scoring method and then move on to the next phase.

176651.description:
You are a cat. You live in a house. You share this house with your pet Hoomin. You goal is to lavish this Hoomin with Affection while causing Mischief elsewhere in the house. The first cat to score 9 Mischief points wins the game!

---

Cantankerous Cats is a light weight, competitive card game centered around the feline propensity for mischief, cunning, and Schadenfreude. Players follow a basic Draw 3, play 2 card format with the ability to attack and interrupt other players. While a game with new players tends to be very polite and rigid; seasoned players will find a faster, brutal game that rewards clever use of hand management, probability, and cunning. Features an adjustable rule set that encourages players to engage with the game at their own comfort level.

This game is currently available directly from the designer's website or through Amazon.com
176651.name: Cantankerous Cats

176652.name: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre
176652.description:
User Summary

Based on the 1974 horror film, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre was published by Wizard Video Games which was a small game company trying to carve out a niche market for adult gamers in the early eighties. The player takes on the role of Leatherface who uses a (surprise) chainsaw to kill tourists who are trespassing on his land. Each tourist killed scores 1,000 points. For every 5,000 points scored you get a free tank of gas to keep your chainsaw running. The game ends when you run out of gas.

176653.name: Fat Chicken
176653.description:
User Summary

This farm/factory management game places you in control of conveyor belts taking animals to the slaughterhouse. Along the way you can add growth hormone, water, and feed as well as several other purchasable upgrades. The aim is to produce the most meat by the end in order to earn money and stars. Strangely enough it feels like a tower defence game at the same time as being vaguely repugnant thematically. An odd game indeed as shown by have an ESRB E for Everyone with a modification for Violent References.

176654.name: Far Cry Compliation
176654.description:
User Summary

The North American release contains Far Cry 2 (includes SP and MP campaigns as a digital remaster of the original release with all patches), Far Cry 3 (includes SP campaign, MP, and co-op), and Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon all on disc. All are "technically" on disc, but Far Cry 2 and Blood Dragon will require a download (codes included with game).

The European release contains Far Cry, Far Cry 2, Far Cry 3, and Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon. All are "technically" on disc, but Far Cry, Far Cry 3, and Blood Dragon will require a download (codes included with game).

176655.name: A.O.C (Amusement d'origine contrôlée)
176655.description:
A trivia about wine for wine lovers.

640 questions with multiple choices in 8 themes.

176657.name: Dungeon World GM Resources Volume 1
176657.description:
Building Blocks for the Dungeon World GM

The Dungeon World rules resist pre-planned adventures, so the GM must prepare by having many different resources ready to construct an improvisational story. The Dungeon World GM Resources series does just that. Each volume provides 50 new and interesting creatures, NPCs, traps, magic items and interesting locations for the GM to use.

176661.name: Star Wars: Force and Destiny Core Rulebook
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
rpgpodcastepisode: Tales from the Hydian Way: Episode 50 – The Core of Destiny Tale
Tales From the Hydian Way: Episode 55 – The Sam Stewart Tale
176661.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Experience the power of the Force in the Star Wars®: Force and Destiny™ roleplaying game! As a Force-sensitive outcast struggling to survive under Imperial rule, you can bring justice to the galaxy, search for the lost remnants of the Jedi order, or fall victim to the dark side’s temptations. Whether you choose the light side or the dark, a powerful destiny awaits you in Force and Destiny.

176662.name: Hero Cards: Set II
176662.description:
From publisher blurb:

This expansion for Hero Kids includes ten more space heroes for use with the space adventures. As with the first set of Space Heroes, these heroes are 100% compatible with all other Hero Kids adventures:

• Goliath - The goliath communicates with his fists and hurled rocks
• Infernal Binder - This infernal's magic can direct the actions of her enemies
• Felinian - The felinian fights tooth and claw for her allies
• Trapper - The alien trapper uses his net to capture wild creatures - and foes
• Fire Binder - The simian binder manifests nadic energy into fiery attacks
• Blade Master - The reptilian's double-ion blade can cut twice as deep
• Ionight - The ion knight wields a matching set of sword and shield
• Insectoid - The insectoid has chitinous armor and a piercing sonic shriek
• Hunter - This tiny hunter is renowned for the accuracy of his sling shots
• Wild Binder - This pandian is barely in control of her nadic magic

176663.description:
Wordariffic is the party word game in which you use letter cards to make a word that best relates to a randomly chosen theme.

Each player gets 11 letter cards and tries to make a word that best relates to a random theme; the last player to put down a word loses their chance to play this round and becomes the judge. The player(s) with the longest word gets 1 point. The player with the best word (as judged by the judge) gets 3 points.

The game ends when the 32 point chips have all been handed out.

Wordariffic is a completely new standalone game influenced by party games such as Apples to Apples or Cards Against Humanity and word creation games like Scrabble or Bananagrams.
176663.name: Wordariffic
boardgamepodcastepisode: TDT # 405 - Metagaming

176666.name: Pits
176666.description:
Pits is a card game for 5 players using a pack of 54 cards, 4 normal suits of 13 cards each and 2 Jokers. The Jokers need to be distinguished as strong ("red") and weak ("black").

The cards are ranked from the strong Joker, weak Joker, all the twos, Aces, Kings etc down to the threes. There is no difference between cards of the same denomination. Jokers are completely wild and can replace any card in forming a meld. Twos are partly wild and can be used to represent a card of equal denomination to another. Twos can never be used in a single sequence.

The object of the game for all the players is to discard all their cards. The dealer initially leads and can play any meld. Players wishing to play must play the same number and type of meld, but higher ranking (e.g. a pair of fours above a pair of threes) or they may pass. It is not compulsory to play cards if a player can do so. Play continues until all players pass. The last person who played can then proceed again with any meld he chooses. If the player who played last goes out (and all the other players have passed) then the player to his left proceeds.

The dealer shuffles the cards and deals them to his left (any cutting of the cards is entirely optional and is left to the choice of the dealer). All the cards are dealt and there should be 11 cards for all players except for the dealer who has 10. In the first hand the dealer is chosen at random, usually the first person to turn up a Jack.

Pits is a corrupt version of the Chinese game Zhēng Shàngyóu.

176667.name: Coin Tower
176667.description:
Coin Tower is a casual abstract game that can be played for adults and children (>6 years). It's a game that have the spirit of Pong hau k’i or Tic-Tac-Toe; it's a little abstract that can be solved but that you can play with your children, or in a pub with casual gamers, because the original idea was to make it on a coaster. You need a little board game and only ten coins, that forms two towers of five coins each.

Players build two towers, five coins each tower. Each player places, per turn, one tower on an empty space on the board.

The first turn is for the player who placed the first tower on board. Per turn each player moves any tower one or two cells on the same row or column, without changing direction. When a player moves a tower can carry as many coins as he wants to the target cell, but he must leave at least one coin in the origin cell. The target cell must be empty and in his movement the tower cannot jump over other towers or other coins. Every move will create new towers, which can be moved in next turns. A tower consists of at least two coins. A coin on a cell cannot move, but can block the movement of other towers.

The game ends when a player on his turn cannot move a tower. The player who made the last move is the winner of the game.

176668.name: Tomb Raiders
176668.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rivals and Renegades Want Your Treasure!

Tomb Raiders brings you an assortment of rival adventurers out for the same thing your heroes want: GOLD, and lots of it! While some adventurers seek fame and glory, and others quest out of duty or idealism, for many it is all about earning a fortune and becoming rich as kings. In some campaigns, however, it can feel like the player characters are the only people really doing much of anything in the world, as everything and everyone else stands still. With Tomb Raiders in hand, those days are over, as we bring you a quartet of rival gangs with their own tactics and goals, with richly detailed stat blocks and personalities for use in and out of combat. These gangs are deadly and dangerous in battle, but long before swords are drawn you can set them on a collision course with the PCs where brinksmanship and bravado combine to make them NPCs your players will love to hate.

These rivals are not necessarily enemies, and might even be ready to make temporary alliances of mutual convenience, but PCs had best be on their guard for the moment when greed trumps loyalty. From scheming black market professionals and corrupt drug dealers to family teams or those whose avarice carried them beyond the threshold of death, Tomb Raiders brings you four complete rival adventuring groups of four characters each, which can be used individually throughout your heroes' adventuring careers or en masse to show how cutthroat the world of treasure-hunting can be. This product is an ideal supplement to the tomb-raiding Egyptian Adventure Path but is a fantastic addition to any dynamic campaign where the PCs can't rest on their laurels lest their rivals outfox them and make off with the treasure before the heroes even arrive!

176669.name: Judgment Day Core Setting Guide
176669.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inquisitor Steel stepped out of the Land Rover and onto the pavement. “You are blocking my passage,” he told the beast.

The beast let out a guttural scream that shook the SUV.

The demon was quite large. Both Inquisitor Steel and Andreson were slightly over six-feet tall, and this demon was at least two-feet taller than them. Inquisitor Steel grabbed his platinum scimitars, sheathing them immediately. Andreson, Wurth, and Mason exchanged their clips for platinum bullets. Frazier grabbed a pair of platinum knives.

The five of them stepped in front of the Land Rover, forming a line between it and the demon.

“Prepare to be my dinner humans!” the demon yelled out.

“I’m not a human,” replied Inquisitor Steel. “I’m an inquisitor. And you, demon, have just made a big mistake.”

Welcome to the supernatural secrets of mankind. Within the pages of Judgment Day you will find the tools necessary to combat the terrors that plague mankind across the three major eras of the occult: the time of the Crusades, the Victorian era, and modern day. Few are able to make this journey, and even fewer are able to stare down the faces of nightmares and do what an inquisitor needs to do. But with this manual, you shall have the tools you need and will hopefully prevail.

Judgment Day includes:

Mechanics for creating supernatural-hunting characters across three eras: Middle Ages during the Crusades, the Victorian era, and the modern age.
Mechanics for Arcane Characters covering thaumaturgy, clockwork science, and psionics.
GM guidance for Judgment Day games and incorporating Shadowed Earth.
A Random Adventure Builder.
An introductory adventure.
… and more!




Judgment Day is a fantasy horror setting for Savage Worlds. It is not a standalone book and requires use of the Savage Worlds core rulebook. GMs may want copies of the Cryptozoology bestiaries.

176670.name: Strange Trails
176670.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to sample the pulp fantasy setting of Weird Adventures before you buy? Strange Trails has got eight articles from the From the Sorcerer's Skull blog, expanded, annotated, and illustrated, plus an "Appendix N" that offer more than a peek at the City and its weird world.

176671.name: Character Pack
176671.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Solar Echoes Character Pack includes ready-made characters for Players and Mission Controllers, plus a character sheet and map icons. Characters are balanced to provide a well-rounded team, capable of dealing with any scenario!

Inside the character pack:

8 pre-made characters, with skills, talents, equipment, tactics, and unique background stories
Sample character sheet (mirrors the pre-made human character, “Zack”)
Blank character sheet (improved version from the updated Player's Guide!)
Map Icons for each character race, ready to print for quick use




Interior B&W artwork includes art for each sample character and map icons for each race by artist Jay Darnell.

176672.name: Steel and Fury: Combat Maneuvers of the Mighty
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
176672.description:
From publisher blurb:

COMBAT AS APPENDIX N INTENDED

The warrior is the cornerstone of any adventuring party. Rushing to meet insurmountable odds head on, face to face with dangerous enemies and loathsome creatures. Armed with steel and fury, a warrior does the dirty work up close and personal, with grisly effect. Yet in the gaming world, outside of a lucky critical hit, this doesn’t always seem to translate well. With Steel and Fury combat becomes more than simply standing toe to toe and following the pattern of...I go...you go.

Combat becomes dynamic and fluid, with combatants taking advantage of tactics and their surroundings. But most of all combat becomes dangerous and in the hands of a skilled warrior combat becomes downright deadly. Now with the use of Steel and Fury, warriors become even more deadly and rightfully so. Showcasing mastery over the weapons they wield by delivering devastating attacks and using the environment to execute precise and skillful maneuvers.

The following Mighty Deeds of Arms are torn straight from the bloody pages of Appendix N material for use by warriors as they quest for gold and glory. Although watching a cultist burn after kicking him into a raging bonfire is a fun and effective way of using a Mighty Deed, sometimes you just want to shatter your foe’s spine or split someone’s skull to the teeth in a spray of blood and brains. With Steel and Fury your game gains a more cinematic and visceral feel, making the warrior a fun and deadly class to play, not just a meat shield able to absorb damage.

The following work contains 32 new Mighty Deeds of Arms, each presented as a full page chart for quick and easy reference during play. So be ready to stand triumphant over your enemy as he futilely attempts to stuff ropes of intestine back into his torn body or pulverize your foe’s internal organs with blunt force trauma. Crush bones, sever limbs, and deliver wicked wounds that bleed uncontrollably or catch your opponent in deadly choke holds and debilitating joint locks while grappling - and that is just to name a few.

176673.description:

In the City of Sevenscore Thousand Smokes, danger lurks down every dark alley. Sinister sorcerers summon terrible forces in their crumbling towers. Treacherous rogues of the Thieves’ Guild prowl the Plaza of Dark Delights. Assassins from the Slayers’ Brotherhood work the Tenderloin District. 176680.description:

Located beside the old stone bridge, The Trip & Trap Inn is a popular stop for travellers. A large tap room on the ground floor of this tavern, with lodgings and beds upstairs and a cellar for storage below.
The Trip and Trap is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Trip and Trap is a multiple level set, comprising 3 battlemaps (each depicting a different floor)

Ground Floor - Set near a river and stone bridge, the ground floor of the tavern surrounds a small courtyard, and features a bar, tables, kitchen, stables and reception area.

It's the Great Wilderness Adventure - and you're invited! So grab your backpack, and join Doug and the other Bluffscouts on their mountain-top camping trip.

Hike up and down the 3-D mountain trails collecting the gear you need for your campsite - firewood, water, a tent. Then hunt for the special badge that's yours and yours alone: Doug's sister Judy needs to find her Bongo Drums... Roger needs to find Stinky the Cat. 176682.description:

Find out what is the mysterious ICEBERG project and why Nazis built a small base on a remote island in the middle of arctic sea.
