176683.name: Collector's Edition Girls' Night StoryClub
176683.description:
What Is It?
Girls’ Night StoryClub is a reinvention of girls’ night in. Actually, it’s so fun it feels more like a girls’ night out! You know Mad Libs? Where the story is written and you fill in the noun, adjective, verb, etc. and you have this funny story? Well Girls’ Night is just the opposite. A ‘Sex and the City’ saucy kinda opposite. We give you a Storybook and Story Starters, People, Places and Things cards for you and and your friends to create one helluva crazy adventure. It’s a girls’ night like you’ve never experienced filled with laughter, connection and creativity.

“Funny, Unpredictable and Unexpectedly Outrageous!”

The Game:
Girls’ Night can spice up any girls’ night in, book club, wine club, dinner party, supper club, or moms’ group. The game can also be customized for a special event activity to shake up networking groups, writing groups, company retreats and women’s conferences. Girls’ Night creates better connections, creative thinking and laughter—the perfect recipe to kick any gathering into high gear. You never know where the story will go! Oh, and FYI, the guys love playing too!

176684.description:
Alewood is a heavily thematic experience that mashes gaming culture and drinking culture together to form a delightfully rowdy social experience. Sit back and enjoy your drink because the game changes with the amount of beer in your pint glass. Pound 'em back, or savor every sip; every strategy has advantages. In Alewood, players are working together to kill outlaws but only one player can fire the final shot and win the bounty. Balancing resources, timing your attacks & a healthy dose of deception plays a major role in the game.

The Story:
You are one of the last honest citizens of Alewood, a town taken hostage by outlaws! With no means of escape, all hope seems lost. Until one day, a stranger in a black carriage arrives with a mysterious offer. A one way ticket out of town with a payment–in blood. Citizens now turn vigilante as you race to be the first townie to gun down 2 Outlaws and win a ticket to freedom.

The Game:
Participants play as characters in Alewood with unique abilities and take turns working jobs, attacking outlaws or dueling each other. Pint glass consumption is only done while someone else is the active player because your drink line will determine how you play on your turn. Trading, striking deals, forming alliances and bluffing is allowed and encouraged. Work as a community to rise against the foes that stole your town but gun for the opportunity when you see it.

On your turn:
1. Place your pint glass flat on the table
2. Choose and resolve 1 Action
3. Draw a card

Actions:
1. Work an Honest Job - Take $2 from the Economy (General coin pile)
2. Take Action - Pay $2 into the Economy and Attack an Outlaw
3. Duel - Both players wager all items and money & duel with dice to see who wins the pot.

The Economy:
Coins are limited in the game and players may choose if/when they would like to change their $1 coins with $5. Without money in the Economy, players cannot work honest jobs or mark damage onto outlaws. A choice must be made in each player whether to chip into the Economy to give everyone a fair shake or to hoard the cash to cripple the competition. However, a player's greed might be their downfall as they'll be tempting targets for thirsty townies. Dueling allows for resources to change hands at any moment.

The Modern Drinking Game:
Alewood is about enjoying your time with friends, savoring your drink & hunting outlaws. Reviews have emphasized that this game is not about getting inebriated, it is about balancing resources and interacting with your characters. Alewood can also be played with any beverage be it sarsaparilla, water or whatever tickles your whisker.

This first issue of an ongoing publication focuses on underdark adventures for low-level and Basic Era games. Inside you will find information on adventures in the underdark, a new race, some new magic items, a brief adventure, and a short tale of fiction.

Deadlands is the award winning, world-famous, original WEIRD WESTERN role-playing game from Pinnacle Entertainment that blends westerns, horror, and steam-punk into a rich world filled with mysticism, magic, supernatural evil, and gunslingers! 176688.name: PRISMS (Issue 1 - Spring 2015)
176688.description:
From publisher blurb:

PRISMS is our community's newest quartlery periodical, focusing on system-agnostic, one-shot scenarios perfect for convention play or a single evening of fun. In our first issue of PRISMS, you will find the following adventure scenarios:

Section Six: A mind-bending psychic horror scenario in which the PCs attempt to escape from an underground government research facility, complete with soldiers ready to pick them off rather than permit them a moment of freedom.
3:10 To Argon City: A space western scenario featuring a train heist gone horribly wrong. The PCs face off against the local marshall, a rival gang, and even a corrupt corporate big shot.
Shards of Malvoc: Three expansive adventure seeds for the Tsunami Living Campaign. The PCs face off against a village of corrupted children, a violent gala for a fallen artist, or a misplaced goblin king.

176689.name: Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon – Angels of Death
176689.description:
At the climactic moment of the 2nd War for Armageddon, three Space Marine chapters descend from the skies above to aid the beleaguered defenders of Hiveworld Armageddon. Nowtake control of the Blood Angels and re-live their contribution to this epic confrontation in a brand new campaign for Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon.

This campaign features 10 all new missions organized into three Acts that follow the exploits and heroic deeds of the Blood Angels during the 2nd War for Armageddon. Engage the Orkish tides in vicious close quarter combat set deep within the confines of the enormous Hive cities that dominate the world of Armageddon.

This campaign is an expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon and requires Warhammer 40,000: Armageddon to be played

Need a few more alien worlds to explore in your Infinite Futures Games? Are your players bored with the same old worlds they have visited already? Explore the danger of space with new this new expansion, so keep your eye out for new releases and expansion for the Infinite Futures system and the Fringe setting.

176718.name: Barony
176718.description:
Barony is a 3D, first-person roguelike. The goal of the game is to descend to the bottom of a dark dungeon known as the Devil's Bastion and destroy an undead lich named Baron Herx, who terrorized the peaceful town of Hamlet in life and is now harboring a curse against the land from beyond the grave. To aid you in your quest are friendly humans who have been eeking out a rough life within the dungeon for generations, as well as any friends you can bring with you in real life: Barony is the first of its kind as a first-person roguelike in that it fully supports cooperative multiplayer for up to four players.

Source: The Game Website.

176719.name: The Fringe
176719.description:
From publisher blurb:

The edge of known space is a varied place. There is no exact or specific definition that determines which worlds make up the Fringe. The Fringe is not a defined territory, like a country or a corp world. It is a frontier - a vague line drawn on star maps that marks the edge of “civilized” space. Worlds near the edge can be on one side of that line one week, and on the other side the next, depending on where the bandits are roaming.

It is also difficult to define what a Fringe world looks like. Such is their variety that, rather than attempting to define what the Fringe worlds are, it is easier to define what these worlds are not: these are not the comfortable and secure planets where people won't kill you over a pair of magnetic boots.

Alien threats, space pirates and lost civilizations all wait those that dare to explore the Fringe. Are you made of the right stuff to make your fortune on the Fringe?

The Fringe is a campaign sourcebook for use with the Infinite Futures 2.0 and the Pathfinder role-playing game. As such, both the Infinite Futures 2.0 and the Pathfinder Core Rulebook™ are needed in order to make full use of the material found within this book

The Fringe is a particular setting for Infinite Futures. In its primary essence, it is a far future space setting designed to incorporate as many different science fiction elements as possible without stretching credulity to its limit. Everything from alien bug hunts to mecha wars are possible on the Fringe. Explore new worlds or plunder the star lanes for pirate booty, its all possible on the Fringe.

176720.name: Aliens of the Fringe
176720.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside you will find a series of new origins for use with Infinite Futures 2.0 which are designed for use in the Fringe setting. Many of these origins have been presented in other Avalon Products, but those included here have been updated to reflect any changes made to make them compatible with IF 2.0. All of these races may be used in the Fringe.

176721.name: The Flayed King
176721.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Flayed King started out as Tullis Well, I had the map and in my game the Northmen use wells in their religious ceremonies. So I started writing with this in mind and somewhere the concept of The Flayed King originated as I wrote. I heavily borrowed from the story of Odin losing his eye to gain wisdom. This guy didn't fair so well. Throw in a bit of Authurian and Egyptian mythos and this is what I created.

I released it in its current state for Swords & Wizardry Appreciation Day.

176722.name: Doglocks and Draughts
176722.description:
From publisher blurb:

TWENTY NEW ITEMS FOR YOUR OLD SCHOOL CAMPAIGN!

PRIMITIVE FIREARMS AND UNSTABLE POTABLES!

Black Box Books

Tome Four: Doglocks and Draughts

INSPIRED by "Swords and Wizardry Apprecation Day", and written over the WEEKEND despite a HANGOVER from my BACHELOR PARTY!

EXCITEMENT!!! ADVENTURE!!! POCKETMODS!!! EXCLAMATION POINTS!!!

DESTROY YOUR ENEMIES with the terrible might of GUNPOWDER, assuming it doesn't BLOW UP and DESTROY YOU FIRST! Like JOHN CARTER and SOLOMON KANE, DISCOVER that UNSTABLE FIREARMS have a proper and EXCITING place in your OLD SCHOOL GAMES!

Or maybe you're MORE INTERESTED in things you can DRINK? Not everyone has the same access to MAGIC or ALCHEMICAL LAB EQUIPMENT, so they have to rely on POWERFUL POTABLES that have both a BENEFIT and a POSSIBLE SIDE EFFECT!

IVANHOE UNBOUND is PROUD to present these TEN FIREARMS and TEN MEDICINES for SWORDS AND WIZARDRY WHITEBOX or ANY OTHER OLD SCHOOL GAME based on the 1974 three booklet version of the WORLD-FAMOUS RPG whose name rhymes with "TRUNCHEONS AND FLAGONS!"

AND SPEAKING OF BOOKLETS, this supplement comes in POCKETMOD FORMAT. Print out a SINGLE PIECE OF PAPER which can be TRANSFORMED with FOLDS and a single cut into a TINY EIGHT PAGE BOOKLET with EVERYTHING YOU NEED to use these two races in your OSR game!

Plus, while THE TINY BOOKLET IS ADORABLE, there's also a couple of larger-size versions so you can KILL MORE TREES!

And as a SPECIAL BONUS, the actual supplement doesn't use EXCESSIVE CAPITAL LETTERS!

176723.name: Chaotic Enhancements
176723.description:
From publisher blurb:

Superlative:adjective
of the highest kind, quality, or order; surpassing all else or others; supreme; extreme:
superlative wisdom.

Spells and the supernatural are a staple part of many games and settings. They allow the user to bend reality to their will or to bring down their wrath on their enemies.

This volume in the Superlative Spells series covers Chaotic Enhancements. These spells could grant you power, or they could make you weaker. Use them at your peril!

The spells you find inside:

Chaotic Attack - Improve or hinder attacks
Chaotic Combat - Make melee more unpredictable
Chaotic Defence - Will that hit be more or less likley to bypass the armor?
Chaotic Movement - Makes the target zig when they want to zag
Chaotic Power - Will you be stronger or weaker?
Chaotic Saves - Your saving throws can be stronger or weaker
Chaotic Speed - The target now cannot control their speed as much as they would like
Chaotic Stats - The targets atrributes will be in flux
Chaotic Targeting - Do you dare fire an arrow into this zone?

176724.name: Sword Saint (Cavalier Archetype)
176724.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new cavalier archetype, the Sword Saint. The sword saint forgoes the mount of the typical cavalier and focuses all of his energy on his chosen weapon, the sword. In addition, a new Cavalier/Samurai Order is provided, the Holy Sacrament.

176725.name: Feats of the Sharpshooter
176725.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats of the Sharpshooter brings you 12 mythic feats for your sharp-eyed ranged combatants to get their enemies in their sights and put them on the ground, or switch hit when the battle comes to them. Unleash death from afar with feats from Opening Volley to Charging Hurler and Arc Slinger to Casterbane Shot!

176726.name: Hellfrost: Arcane Lore
176726.description:
From publisher blurb:

PUT SOME MAGIC INTO YOUR GAME!

Rassilon is a world of magic. Tendrils of magical energy emanating from the moon touch every creature, granting them the potential to weave, focus, and manipulate magic. All practitioners share an understanding of how to manipulate the threads of magic, but each arcane tradition is unique in its approach to the art.

This guidebook expands the major and minor magical traditions of Rassilon, delving deeper behind the scenes and presenting new rules.

Within this tome of arcane lore you’ll find information on druidic pacts with nature, the Magocracy’s famed schools of heahwisardry, the elementals planes and their unearthly occupants, the nature of the lost dwarven runes, song mages’ storytelling traditions, and more!

176727.name: Fantasy8s Oddities
176727.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy8s Oddities is a collection of various systems, NPCs and creatures for use with the 'Crazy 8s Rules-Lite Universal Game Engine and the Fantasy8s setting expansion. This sourcebook provides new systems, races, creatures and magic items for use with Fantasy8s.

176728.name: Shrieking Eagle
176728.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is the Shrieking Eagle, a close air support fighter jet.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as illustrations.

176729.name: Tiikeri's Revenge (Pathfinder)
176729.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-5 PCs of Levels 6-7

“When revenge calls, act as the tiger... with hard-favor’d rage!”

In the sub-continent, some extreme religious cults have taken to eradicating the essentially-neutral local weretigers. One such band, the law-focused Light-from-Darkness, developed a precise ritual that withdrew a weretiger’s essence to its exact last drop. When one weretiger somehow resisted the ritual three times, the temple’s followers became unsure what to do, so did nothing.

This gave Kaanne Tiikeri - a rakshasa - an opportunity to learn about his captors even as they began to realize their mistake. When Tiikeri’s chance came, he escaped his chains, assumed various temple members’ forms, and slaughtered them all. Now he rests and ponders the fate of those nearest and dearest to the former clergy, for revenge calls...

176730.name: Hexslinger
rpgseries: Cartoon Action Hour Season 3 Series Book
176730.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this Cartoon Action Hour: Season 3 series book by Shane Hensley, which can best be described as a hybrid of westerns, science-fiction and fantasy, groups of hexslingers (rangers armed with clockwork firearms hurtling manite slugs “hexed” with various magical powers) patrol the untamed Outlands in an effort to make life safe for settlers and travelers alike.

Details on the Wizardry West
Information on hexslingers, including rules on how to create them as Player Characters
8 ready-to-use Player Characters
3 very detailed episode seeds to get your group into the action
2 extremely nasty villains (an orc warlord named Karnak the Unstoppable and a vile dragon known as Mayng)
12 critters
4 types of Goons
1 Playset (Fort Fannon)
Sidebars that offer additional information on the setting and characters
Numerous full-color illustrations that bring the series to life

176731.description:
These gladiators are mostly promo chips created by Chip Theory Games for the Hoplomachus series. All CF Gladiators work for all 3 Hoplo games. Hoplomachus: Origins has a special ruleset for a CF Gladiator only mode.

CF Gladiators have been awarded as KS stretch goals, CTG tributes, Convention chips, BGG promos, and more. These chips represent people influential to Chip Theory Games, convention volunteers, specially themed units for KS goals, etc.
176731.name: Crowd Favor Gladiators

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
176734.description:
From the ashes of war, nations rise to power in the atomic age. Each player takes control of a nation struggling for power in the latter part of the 20th century. They build up their nation’s industry, commerce, and government by acquiring resources, building structures, and tapping sources of energy. The price of oil is going up, and nuclear energy is the wave of the future. The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire is set in the same "universe" as The Manhattan Project, but it's a standalone game, not an expansion.

The major threat in Energy Empire is not war, but uncertain global impacts, that result from side effects of industrialization and pollution. Many actions come with a cost. So, as nations become more industrious, they also increase the amount of pollution in the environment. Careful use of science can mitigate the harmful effects of industry, and can also help avert global crises.

Energy Empire uses worker placement, tableau-building, and resource management mechanics. On each turn, a player can choose to either work or generate. On a work turn, a player plays a single worker on the main board, then uses workers and energy to activate cards in their tableau. Players may spend energy to use an occupied space on the main board, so no spaces are ever completely blocked. On a generate turn, players get to renew their supply of energy by rolling "energy dice" that represent nuclear, coal, oil, solar, and other forms of energy.
176734.name: The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire

176736.name: The Ren & Stimpy Show Presents: Stimpy's Invention
videogameversion: North American SEGA Game Gear edition
176736.description:
Game Box

Nickelodeon's hit animated series The Ren & Stimpy Show comes to Genesis. Stimpy's latest invention, the Mutate-O-Matic, explodes, wreaking havoc in the neighborhood! The town heroes chase down the pieces through dangerous challenges - traveling from Mr. Horse's over-populated refrigerator to the far reaches of the great outdoors!

Be Ren or Stimpy. Ren wallops with a fly swatter! Stimpy coughs hairballs and snaps attackers with his bath towel!

Ren & Stimpy team up for unique antics. Ren rolls Stimpy like a bowling ball. Stimpy spins Ren's ears and they both fly up and away!

Six city scenes plus a maze of sub-levels loaded with familiar cronies. Watch out for Lump & Loaf, Kodiak Marmosets, Cabbage Heads and the Walrus!

176737.name: The Candy Man
176737.description:
The Candy Man is a Symbol Matching, Set Building Strategy game for all ages.

In this game, each player has a hand of ingredient cards. In the middle of the table, there are five recipe cards, which show different ingredients. Players take turns drawing new ingredients and playing ingredients on the recipe. On their turn, players can either play one ingredient on a recipe, or play all missing ingredients on a recipe. If a player plays the last missing ingredient, he scores that recipe, and it is replaced by a new recipe. Play continues until a player reaches 100 points.

The game has different game modes. The basic game is aimed at younger players, and allows them to focus on the symbol matching. The other game modes add Golden Ticket cards to the game, which are special actions that are rewarded randomly, and Role Cards, which give the players different special powers.

176738.name: Math Kings
176738.description:
Math Kings is a collection of fun math's games in one box!

Classic Mode
Played on the board side with numbers. Classic Mode can be considered a Math's version of scrabble. The extra numbers on the board once used add to your points score for your sum.

Almost Countdown
A guide for the dice order Left to right is indicated on the back of the game manual. Players have to make a sum to match the dice roll amount (1-7 D6 Dice). Can be played against the timer. Players sums are hidden behind screens and only revealed once all players have made the sum or the time has ran out.

Advanced Sum up
Players have to use the shards to display the sum total. Players sums are hidden behind screens and only revealed once all players have made the sum or the time has ran out.

Pure Brain Power
Played on the board side with no numbers. Pure Brain Power eliminates any extra points from numbers on the board and comes down to pure math's. This mode is for you uber math's people out there.

176739.description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other. Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed. If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this ain’t no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because it’s full of surprises and pure fun. Highly recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

The set, for the Italian market, Scienza e Natura contains historical events which are related to science and nature discoveries and strangeness. Like all Anno Domini the Scienza e Natura edition can be played as standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

Anno Domini Scienza e Natura is a functional merger of two previous set themes, Nature and Wissenschaft & Forschung.
176739.name: Anno Domini: Scienza e Natura

176742.description:
A modified YV-666 light freighter, Hound’s Tooth was the signature vessel of one of the galaxy’s most notorious bounty hunters and slavers, the fearsome Trandoshan Bossk.

The Hound’s Tooth Expansion Pack brings this infamous freighter to life as a towering, large-base miniature starship for the Scum and Villainy faction, rendered at the game’s standard 1/270 scale. You’ll also find four YV-666 ship cards, a new mission, and thirteen upgrades, including the Hound’s Tooth Title, which allows your YV-666 pilot to survive imminent destruction by escaping aboard the Nashtah Pup, a unique Z-95 Headhunter. The Hound’s Tooth Expansion Pack also comes with a ship card for the Nashtah Pup and the rules for deploying it, though to fly it, you’ll need the miniature starship from the Most Wanted Expansion Pack or Z-95 Headhunter Expansion Pack.
176742.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Hound's Tooth Expansion Pack

176743.description:
From the website:

5150: Urban Renewal is our Sci-Fi RPG. Players adventure in and around New Hope City gaining Fame and Fortune while increasing their abilities. NHC is a complete Blade Runnereque urban environment inhabited by over 50 professions, with humans and aliens alike.

The game includes a low bookkeeping complete campaign system to link your adventures and track your progress. Urban Renewal generates your adventures with no two ever being the same!

Urban Renewal is playable solo, cooperatively and competitively, head to head and playable with any figures in any scale

Urban Renewal is the core rules for a long line of supplements to follow, starting with our first, New Hope City PI.



A sandbox style game, play a one-off standard miniatures game with your opponent on one side of a city block as a group of gangers and yours on the other as the police and have at! (Or step things up and include cybernetics and "Cyndees" and smuggled Star Army weapons to add to the carnage) Last man standing wins!Add Attributes and skills to make the game more RPG-like, letting your figures advance between games, adding more goals like finding lost technology, raiding corporate headquarters or simply going gambling for an evening and making it out of the casino alive!

Several pre-made scenarios are included in the book allowing you to customize your games to the complexity you desire.

Use whatever miniatures you have around!

If you liked 5150:Star Army, this merely takes that world and narrows the focus down to 1 figure and one city.
176743.name: 5150: Urban Renewal

176744.description: A heavily armed bomber that could double as an escort or reconnaissance vessel, the Rebellion’s K-wing was frequently flown on strafing runs against planetary targets and slow-moving capital ships. In X-Wing the K-wing’s surprising acceleration, heavy armor plating, and devastating ordnance make it an outstanding ship for hit-and-run operations. Its four shields and five hull make it one of the game's most durable small-base fighters, and it pairs this durability with a primary turret weapon that boasts an attack value of “2.” On top of this, the ship comes with the new SLAM action, which allows it to race across the battlefield and deploy its bombs at an unprecedented speed. In addition to its pre-painted K-wing miniature, sculpted at 1/270 scale, the K-wing Expansion Pack comes with four ship cards and nine upgrades that dramatically improve the efficiency of your ordnance.
176744.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – K-wing Expansion Pack

176745.name: Predator 0 (ICONS)
rpgseries: The Super Villain Handbook Character Pack
176745.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spun from the pages of the Super Villain Handbook, we introduce Predator 0! Hailing from the Hidden City in Africa, Predator seeks to one day return and conquer it. While biding her time, she builds a fanataical following of the lost and forgotten. One day soon she and her army will storm the gates of the Hidden City and take what is rightfully hers!

176746.name: To Stand Together
176746.description:
From publisher blurb:

To Stand Together was made to be an ideal start-up adventure for a BASH! Ultimate Edition campaign. It adds some background history to the Heroes’ world, brings in an ongoing adversary, and (most importantly) provides something that is usually very difficult to come up with in a roleplaying campaign: a reason to form a group and also to stay together as as a team.

This adventure can also be inserted into an ongoing campaign by using established or known occult groups from your game world and an older magical-based NPC. Game statistics and mechanics-related things are available at the end of the adventure.

Ideally, this adventure works for a group of Street-Level Heroes. It works well for a Silver or Bronze Age style campaign.

Background: Once, there was a war between the Pit and Earth. Sumerian sorcerers battled against an otherworldly evil called Demonicus, who hungered to enter our dimension and devour its energies.

The sorcerers cast bindings in the form of an amulet, gambling their own life essences when
the world’s mana was not enough. The amulet, known as the “Star of Ea”, was enchanted to
prevent interdimensional rifts from opening, denying free access to our world by supernatural or otherworldly beings.

Seemingly random crimes began ocurring in the 1940s, and these were traced to a cult controlled by Demonicus. A group of heroes was formed, calling themselves "The Alliance", each taking ownership of a piece of the Star of Ea... but that was over 60 years ago... and Demonicus is gathering his strength once again. Can the last surviving member of the Alliance find new Heroes worthy of the name in time... and will they be able To Stand Together to protect the world from it's greatest peril?

176747.name: Supervillain Showdown #1: Hardhate
176747.description:
From publisher blurb:

Supervillain Showdown is a series of short publications detailing supervillains and their stats, lairs, vehicles, minions, plots or any sort of details that centers around supervillains and the way they go about doing their business.

Supervillain Showdown #1

In this issue, you meet the 5 members of Hardhate, a construction-themed supervillain team bent on paying back the government for what they consider unfair treatment.

176748.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module #3: Death Knell Delve, Part I
176748.description:
From publisher blurb:

Screams echo through the night. You hasten to a window and look out upon a horrific scene. In the flickering light of torches and the wan moonlight monstrous forms shamble, lurch and skitter through the streets attacking citizens and bursting into shops and homes. Many of the unarmed citizens run, some take up arms and turn to fight, too many die. What new evil has risen from the depths to plague the town of Ravenor? Are you brave enough to face the Death Knell Delve?

The third in the Adventure Module series set in Ravenor, Death Knell Delve is the biggest, baddest Adventure Module released to date. In fact, this adventure is so large we’ve had to break it into two parts! This new Adventure Module is packed with all new material, including new monsters to menace the characters, new tricks and traps to test your players and, of course, new treasures! Death Knell Delve includes 18 Encounter cards, 18 Event cards, 18 Search cards, 18 Treasure cards, and 9 additional Shadow Hall cards. That’s twice as many Encounter, Event and Search cards than any Adventure Module before!

Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, and playable solo or with a group, with or without a GM, Death Knell Delve, Part I, brings you a fun and exciting adventure you’ll be able to play again and again. Death Knell Delve does require the use of Assault on the Underworld and Scourge of the Scurvlings. In addition, depending on how events unfold, or if you get creative, you can connect this adventure to DK1 Death Fog.

Death Knell Delve is a huge adventure and one you won’t want to miss. Gather your heroes, for glory and vengeance, and prepare to undertake the Death Knell Delve!

176749.name: Dwarves
176749.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dwarves of Celmae are simultaneously your typical dwarves and anything but. Haunted by guilt, this pious race has devoted themselves to righting the wrongs of their past. Above the surface and below, the united dwarf clans consider themselves the chosen people of the god Adan, and their mission is to save the world.

Included:

The Forge Priest Hybrid Class: A specialist crafter that can imbue his allies with the ability to share his spells.
New Feats.
New Spells.
New Traits.
New item qualities known only to dwarves.
Overview of two Dwarven kingdoms: The Copper Crown Mountains and the Duergar controlled Zamcelty.




And much, much more!

176750.name: Many Ways To Die
176750.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three solo adventures, many ways to die...

Previously released individually, now collected together with new artwork. You can try delving under the ocean with the Deepwater Dwarves or you can experience life on the 'other side' as something supernatural as you try to claw your way back to life; then again, you could see if you have what it takes to stand guard duty in the city when the assassins are out to hit an important visitor.

Yes, there are many ways to die...

176751.name: Vathak Terrors: Horrors of Halsburg
176751.description:
From publisher blurb:

An ancient evil turns its eyes to the future in the necromantic mecca of Halsburg, where the servants of Ivar von Houlsmann seek to perfect the already formidable vampire race. Steep is the price of progress, however, and the discarded results of the town’s vile experiments plague its gloomy streets: Parasitic poxiva lurk in alleyways, scurrying out of the shadows to prey on unsuspecting passersby; watery vaquires haunt canals and waterways, eager to drown and possess any who tread too close; and awesome nightsuns, feared by the living and idolized by the undead, bathe their surroundings in deadly grayscale light.

Vathak Terrors: Horrors of Halsburg is a supplement for Shadows over Vathak, especially those exploring the area of the Colonies. This product is a perfect supplement for any Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, especially horror. The Vathak Terrors product line presents an assortment of creatures and encounters to use in your next adventure. Included in this product are the Poxivum (CR1), the Vaquire (CR7), and the Nightsun (CR13).

176752.name: Breachworld Breach Creature Folio #1: Dinosaurs
176752.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ripped from some other dimension, or perhaps even from Earth's own prehistoric past, dinosaurs once again roam the Earth. Encounter Drakes, Raptors, Spinebacks, and Trikes across the Civilized Lands and beyond, by air, land, and sea.

The first in a new series of monstrous mini-expansions for the Breachworld RPG, these dinosaurs offer new avenues for adventure, fully integrated into the fabric of the world.

Included in this supplement:

Four distinct dinosaur Breach Creatures, described and illustrated
Two sets of stats for each creature for varying challenge levels
A random encounter table for each creature
Nine pieces of dinosaur-related adventuring gear for your campaign

176753.name: Struwwelpeter
176753.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space '75'
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a red marked space follow instructions...

176754.name: #Harshmode Monday (#24 - Apr 20, 2015)
176754.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

176755.name: Doki Doki Love!
176755.description:
Welcome to the world of Doki Doki Love!. Love is in the air and it is your job to help your Hero find that special person in their life. Things aren’t as simple as that though, oh no, this world is full of all the Anime tropes you’ve come to know over the years. Tropes are elements that appear in multiple creative works, so if you watch Anime, you will know lots of the tropes that are used. Can you help the General Protagonist end up with the Girl Next Door? Or will the obsessive Yandere try to keep them apart? Maybe you’re lucky and the Yandere isn’t interested in you, but you still need to worry about your Rival getting in your way, along with all the other guys trying to get the Girl Next Door’s attention.

Heroes and Love Interests are drawn randomly, so each time you play Doki Doki Love!, you will have to find the best way to make you Hero appeal to the various Love Interests. While it may seem easy to just increase your Appeal and Encounter a Love Interest, be warned that it is not. Other Heroes will try to lower your Appeal and get in your way. Who said love was simple? You must fight with all your soul to end up with the person you want! And don’t worry, you can mess up their plans as well.

The base set for Doki Doki Love! contains tropes found in slice of life, romance/comedy, and school Anime. Do not fret though! There are plenty tropes in all kinds of Anime, so maybe (hopefully) there will be new ones coming in the future… And don’t worry if you don’t know many tropes, you will learn more after playing this game.

Oh, and this game is about Anime and love, so you know some Ecchi elements will find their way into the game.

176760.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

176761.name: Fish Fight!
176761.description:
Story:
Under the sea, eight fighters are ready to fight for their lives. So, pick up your card to join this fight, develop your strategy to eat others’ fishes and raise your score.
The victory shall be yours!
Warning: Don’t think too complicated, otherwise you may gain nothing but laughter.


Introduction:
This is an exciting and easy game. In each round, all you have to do is play one card, execute its ability and calculate your points.
So, think hard and play your cards at the right time. Your little Krill will knock down others big Shark!

176762.name: Predator 0 (Supers!)
rpgseries: The Super Villain Handbook Character Pack
176762.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spun from the pages of the Super Villain Handbook, we introduce Predator 0! Hailing from the Hidden City in Africa, Predator seeks to one day return and conquer it. While biding her time, she builds a fanataical following of the lost and forgotten. One day soon she and her army will storm the gates of the Hidden City and take what is rightfully hers!

176763.description:
Be the first, who visits all ten numbered points, avoiding major mistakes.

Players choose any starting point. Then, they take turns, rolling the die and following the streets/roads in recommended directions. Players should consider all traffic signs - mistakes will lead to penalties.
Likely published late 1950s.
176763.name: Die Kleine Fahrschule  Cabrio

176765.name: Dungeon Master's Screen: Elemental Evil
176765.description:
Publisher blurb:

This screen is the perfect companion for those Dungeon Masters running the Princes of the Apocalypse adventure. The front is adorned with intimidating images of the Elemental Cults’ leaders while the back provides quick reference to game conditions, random encounters tables and a map of the Dessarin Valley.

176766.description:
Centuries is a card drafting, deck building card game.

Taking place during the turbulent but exciting Renaissance, players take on the role of a leader of a city of Renaissance Europe. Players try to construct a Major Construction within their city, collect resources, expand the their treasuries, enlarge armies, develop technology, build structures, establish trade, and colonize the world, sometimes with the help of notables like Leonardo DaVinci or Queen Elizabeth. Be the Leader who exceeds what other Leaders can do and become victorious!

Played in three Centuries, players collect resource cards in order to afford other cards that in turn award the player with victory points. A key mechanic involves deciding which cards to pass to the other Players and which to keep in a modest supply deck. Modular in nature, Players can play from 3 - 6 modules. With the 3 module game, a fun and fairly short game can be enjoyed even by novice players. With the full game, Players enjoy a challenging game that will stretch the skills of the most hardened strategist.

Cards are lavishly decorated with the great works of art from the Renaissance and can be played in multiple ways: either in a basic manner or with an added bonus, played to build the major construction, passed, kept to enlarge the supply deck, or discarded for money.

Centuries is a fast-paced, strategy card game with limitless replayability with no game playing exactly the same.
176766.name: Centuries
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

176767.name: TROPES: Zombie Edition
176767.description:
From publisher blurb:

TROPES: Zombie Edition (TZE) is a game of post-apocalyptic zombie survival horror. TZE is about surviving the zombie apocalypse for one more night. It is designed for one-shot play and should be cinematic and action packed!

Picture this: You're minding your own business on your way to work or school. You've had your nose buried in Facebook all morning, so you don't really know what's going on in the real world outside of who woke up on the wrong side of the bed, what type of coffee your friends are drinking, and who got the highest score on Candy Crush last night. The light turns green, but traffic is gridlocked and no one is moving. Suddenly, there's a commotion up ahead and a bunch of people start screaming and running towards you. Close behind them, you see a mob of freshly risen zombies shambling in your direction. What do you do?

176769.name: TROPES: Zombie Edition Companion!
176769.description:
[Publisher's Blurb]

A sourcebook for critically acclaimed TROPES: Zombie Edition, this product give your six (6) new zombie mutants, twelve (12) new NPCs, and eighteen (18) pregenerated characters ready to drop into any urban outbreak.

176770.name: Flight of the Zombie
176770.description:
[Publisher's Blurb]

Flight of the Zombie is a short zombie outbreak scenario designed for 3-6 players of TROPES: Zombie Edition. The outbreak takes place aboard the closed confines of a jumbo jet and involves several different types of zombies. The have approximately one hour of "real time" to make their escape before things go from bad to worse.

176771.name: Spellbook Cards: Elemental
176771.description:
Publisher blurb:

With the rise of the elemental powers, the world will also see new magic emerging and a selection of new spells, all of which can be found in the new Elemental Evil Spell Deck. These elemental spell cards have their own unique visual look, as well as a visual reference for the class that can add them to their spell books. This makes this deck very versatile.


From the back cover:

Contains 43 durable, laminated cards detailing elemental cantrips and spells. A perfect reference tool for spellcasters of every type.


User summary:

Includes 43 cards for new spells described in the Elemental Evil Player's Companion supplement, plus replacement cards for the mislead spell (omitted in the original printing of the Arcane deck) and the destructive wave spell (omitted in the original printing of the Paladin deck).

176772.name: Die Priester der Krähen
176772.description:
Publisher Blurb

Was könnte angenehmer sein als ein Urlaub im Kreise seiner Lieben? Vermutlich ein Urlaub, bei dem man nicht mit dem Verschwinden eines Freundes, Intrigen, Leichenfunden, uralter Magie, verrückten Einsiedlern, Kreaturen aus dem Meer oder anderen Dimensionen und weiteren unerfreulichen Zeitgenossen konfrontiert wird ...
Doch bei einem all-inclusive-Urlaub a la Cthulhu kann man davon ausgehen, dass genau das enthalten ist! So natürlich auch in den beiden hier präsentierten Abenteuern Die Priester der Krähen und Die Bucht der Toten – bei denen es sich um bewährte, für die Edition 7 überarbeitete Klassiker aus dem bekannten Magazin Cthuloide Welten handelt. Beide Abenteuer spielen in Deutschland und sind besonders für Neueinsteiger geeignet.
Die enthaltenen Konvertierungsregeln erlauben auch die Nutzung früherer Regeleditionen.


User description

Contains two adventures previously published in Cthuloide Welten with rules for CoC 6th and 7th Edition.

176773.description:
Wolf In The Fold is a game of tile placement and cooperation. The wolf pack is on the hunt, and they want your herd. Build fences and hire shepherds to protect your flock. If the wolves eat more sheep than you can round up, you lose the game!

Simple rules make Wolf in the Fold fun for younger children, but this game is not suitable for very small children who may choke on the game tiles.
176773.name: Wolf In The Fold

176774.description:
Your chances for survival flicker and fade in We Are The Walking Dead expansion to Bang!: The Walking Dead Survivor Showdown.

This expansion to Bang!: The Walking Dead includes an additional player board for an 8 player game, as well as the possibility to return from the dead.
176774.name: Bang!: Walking Dead – We are the Walking Dead Expansion

176775.description:
Treasure Tomb is a game of strategic tile-laying, dice-rolling, and card collecting. Players lay tiles to construct pathways through the mummy's tomb. Draw a treasure card when you pass a treasure token or place the mummy when you land on a sarcophagus token. Treasure cards can be either event cards or gold. Place the gold in a face-up pile near you. The first person to collect 50 gold wins the game.

But beware! Others may steal your gold with event cards or boot you from the maze.
176775.name: Treasure Tomb

176779.name: Dragonball Z: Battle of Z
176779.description:
Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Z is a fighting video game based on the manga and anime franchise Dragon Ball, and is the first new game in the series to be released since Dragon Ball Z Budokai: HD Collection in 2012. It was developed by Artdink and published by Bandai Namco Games. The game is based on the new film Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Gods (but still features the same basic story of every Dragon Ball game), and features the first video game appearance of Goku's Super Saiyan God form[1] as well as the characters Beerus and Whis.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Z", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

176780.description:
These Crowd Favor Gladiators are something of a collectible chip that can be used on all 3 games of the Hoplomachus series.

These CF Gladiators are a limited chip that may be found at conventions, in special promo packs, during Kickstarters, etc.

These chips are designed solely for some added fun and flavor, and they are NOT part of the Hoplomachus storyline. We designed these to honor our demo volunteers, reviewers, backers, and other influential people!
176780.name: Hoplomachus: Crowd Favor Gladiators

176785.name: Fabula Mortis
176785.description:
User Summary

As close to a MOBA as you can get without being one, this game has maps to explore that combine fairy tale and Steampunk themes, but really aims at player vs. player combat. You can choose from 6 base characters that have special abilities and 12 different types of weapons. There is no single player option and the tutorial is currently an brief information file.

176786.description:
Seekers of a Hidden Light enriches the Shadows of Malice base game by offering additional opportunities, challenges, and flavor for players seeking an added layer of atmosphere and theme. Seekers of a Hidden Light introduces three new elements to Shadows of Malice: bait, quests, and Lux.

With bait, the avatars can more easily provoke out-of-lair encounters and influence the type of creatures they encounter... which is especially useful in accomplishing quests! Quests are specific gathering and slaying tasks of varying difficulty assigned to the avatars by Mystics and rewarded with soulshards, potions, and... Lux! With enough Lux, the avatars can commission powerful Lux Potions and have potent Lux Runes carved into their items. Armed with Lux Potions and Lux Runes, the avatars are superbly suited to dispatch the Stronghold Guardians, destroy the Shadows, and thwart Xulthûl's plans for world domination.
176786.name: Shadows of Malice: Seekers of a Hidden Light

176787.description:
An expansion for Dungeon Dice ,

Colosseum!
Heroes band together against extra powerful opponents for a chance to score some rare loot!

adding:

Epic Monsters: are gigantic monsters (22mm dice) that all players fight at once over multiple rounds. New victory condition is set to 7 Fame

176788.name: Herzblatt
176788.description:
A German card game played with the 32-card deck composed of the values seven through ace in the four suits. This game is a simplified version of the German game Skat - in that the trumps are fixed (always hearts), but the ranking is still the same:
A-10-K-Q-J-9-8-7.

Depending on how many players you have, you reduce the 32 card deck further.





Players

Cards In Deck

# Dealt to each player



5

32 (7 -> A)

6



4

30 (remove 7♥ & 7♦)

7



3

26 (remove all 7's + 8♥ & 8♦)

8



2

20 (10 -> A)

9




Players take turns after dealing to see if they want to make a go of a play. Goal of making a go at it is to get 66 or more points in the tricks you capture. If you make 66, you get your wager (fixed, say 1 pt). If you make a go and fail to get 66 pts you loose 2x wager (say -2 pts). If you make a go and fail to get more than 33, you loose 4x the wager (say -8 pts). If you make a go and succeed and keep the sum of everyone else to 33 or below, you win 3x the wager (say 3 pts).

The points are: A=11, 10=10, K=4, Q=3, J=2, and 7,8,9 =0.
So there are 120 points on offer, and you need to capture 66 of them. Remember the 10 is better than the king, and there are rules for using trumps and playing trumps and suits - so if you don't think you can make it, pass the option to make a play to the next person. If the question to play goes around the table fully and no one takes it, its a bust and reshuffle ( There is no Skat like option of playing with a crappy hand).

Once cards are dealt there will be 2 cards left over - leave those face down. Whomever makes a play, gets to draw those 2 card into their hand and discard 2 cards, to set aside. Those set-aside cards count in the scoring of the player making a play. So its important what you discard - consider the rules of when suits and trumps need to be played.

First player left of the dealer plays first card (regardless of who decided to make a go of it this hand). You have to play the suit led with, if you have it. If you don't have it, but have hearts, you must trump with a heart (your choice which). If you don't have hearts either, play any card - but you won't get that trick. If hearts is the first card played, you MUST play hearts if you have it and you MUST play a higher heart if you can.

This way, you can see that its possible to force others to play hearts at certain times and get the trump cards out of play, and then still control play and be able to bring home points with less valuable cards like face-cards.

It sounds very complex, but its not nearly as bad as it seems, and a great light version of Skat. Unlike Skat that requires exactly 3 players, this plays with 2-5 players.

176789.name: Oceanica
176789.description:
The world is flooding, and it is your job to build the biggest, happiest, most populous fleet for humanity to survive on.

Players roll and draft dice to gain the resources they need to build various types of ships to add to their fleet, and to fend off regularly occurring storms.

Players score points by building ships, upgrading ships, increasing population, and having high morale.

176790.name: Brains, Grains & Trains
176790.description:
The railway building farmpocalypse game!

Players place workers and play cards to take actions, which include farming (gathering resources), laying rails, delivering goods to cities, and combating zombie infestations.

Generally, a player plays one card per turn, which stays discarded until the player takes a Recover action. Recovering lets a player get all of their cards back, but it also causes zombies to spread. Zombies block cities from being delivered to, and also occupy worker slots, preventing players from getting supplies.

176792.name: Heavy Steam: Armament Pack
176792.description:
Heavy Steam’s heavy miniatures are designed to have detachable arms – but only come with one pair of arms each pre-attached. When you customize your steam titan with the many weapon cards in the game you’ll have to suspend disbelief when looking at the miniature.

However, now with the Armament Pack you can customize your miniature steam titans to your heart’s desire. An Armament Pack comes with 2 pairs of each weapon (right and left arm variant) matching the weapon cards in the base game. That is a total of 18 miniature arms. In addition it will come with 1 new weapon – the special rail gun and matching weapon card! This equals a grand total of 20 miniatures.

176793.name: Heavy Steam: Pilot Expansion
176793.description: Freshly recruited and spoiling for a fight, expand your tactical options with twenty four custom pilot cards!

176794.name: Heavy Steam: Kickstarter Exclusives
176794.description:
The box of exclusives was included only with the Kickstarter campaign.

It contains the following:
2x New Player Boards
2x Powerfully Exclusive Pilot Cards
3x SteamPunk Themed Promotional Zpocalypse Cards
5x Tactical Terrain Cards
5x Additional Weapons Cards
2x New Minis (Zpocalypse and Fairytale themed)

176795.description:
You are a half-blood between vampire and werewolf. You have power! You can be a vampire! A werewolf! A human! You are one of the most powerful creatures in history — but you were too powerful. All humans, vampires and werewolves are now searching for you to kill. You lost your home, parents, friends, everything by them. There is nothing left except bloody revenge.

The Night of Horror Dice is a simple dice game. You have three health points for each turn. First, choose your ability. You can use one ability from human, vampire and werewolf. Each abilities has unique effects. Then, pick up three enemy dices from pouch and throw. As the result you gain or lose your health, catch them or they might runaway. You can throw another three dices or stop your revenge. All your captured enemies are your score. Strong enemy gives more score. If you caught four or more enemies in a type, you got additional score. Careful about your health, and catch enemies as many as possible.

Star Trek - Attack Wing: Halik Raider Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 20 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Halik Raider is a Kazon Raider class ship.
176801.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Halik Raider Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

176802.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing - Scorpion 4 Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

176803.description:
Since the beginning of time, two opposing forces have been the pillars of the universe and coexist in eternal balance. Our Goddess in her infinite wisdom has sent a group of Overseers to protect our world. They have the power to bend human traits to their will, and they will always battle between each other to create the perfect symmetry between virtues and vices of humankind. You will now choose whether to find the best balance — or completely crush it for your own good.

Overseers is a drafting and bluffing game with a twist. Each player represents an Overseer whose objective is to bend traits in their favor to create the most dominant combination of virtues and vices. The game has three main phases:

1] Drafting: Each player receives six cards at random from the deck, selects one of them, then passes the rest to the player sitting on their left. The goal is to build up the combination that will grant them the most victory points. Some cards grant points on their own, while others require the same type of cards to earn more points.

2] Judgement: All players place their five trait cards in front of them in two rows: two face down and three face up to show the cards they chose. Give the information available, the Overseers then discuss which player has the strongest possible combination. After deliberating, players vote for this person using their token. The chosen player must then admit or deny the verdict:

— If they admit having the strongest combination, they must then discard two cards from their combination.
— If they deny this, the showdown phase happens, with all players revealing their scores. If the chosen player has the strongest combination, they lose the two cards that grant the most points; if not, instead they take one additional card of their choice from the discard pile.

3] Scoring: Each player shows all cards in front of them, then calculates their score.

The game might have other phases depending on the type of overseers being played as each character has special abilities that can change the outcome of the game, such as being able to peek at another player's hidden cards, steal a card before the scoring phase, or transform one card into another.

At the end of each round, players secret their victory point (VP) tokens to keep their score secret, and after three rounds whoever has the most VPs wins.
